As much as 1 in 10 students have dyslexia. We've created an app to test your ability,

title: Dyslexia Reading Test
description:
If you believe your child may have a reading disability or dyslexia, screen them for free today. We have helped hundreds of smart kids who struggled with reading. The Online Reading Tutor screener can help identify specific reading problems and recommend an effective training program that will help your child develop fluent, automatic decoding skills. When decoding becomes automatic, comprehension improves dramatically.

The Online Reading Tutor dyslexia screener only takes 5 to 10 minutes to complete. You will be provided with immediate results of the assessment.  Pending the results, you may request a call from our reading specialists to see if we are a good fit to help your child.  If you believe your child may have a specific reading disability or Dyslexia, screen them for free today. The Online Reading Tutor screener can help diagnose specific reading problems and recommend an effective training program that will help your child develop fluent, automatic decoding skills. When reading becomes automatic or fluent, comprehension improves dramatically.

The dyslexia test only takes 5 to 10 minutes to complete. You will be provided with immediate results of the assessment.

After completing the screener, you may sign up for a Free Trial of our Orton-Gillingham based software. Our software has been endorsed by the Council of Administrators of Special Education (CASE). If you decide to choose ORT, your child will almost certainly start to see significant gains after 30 hours of training.  Students with an IEP for their learning disability are our specialty.

The Online Reading Tutor Assessment is Patent Pending, and Copyright ¬© Online Reading Tutor 2014, 2015

title: Letter & Number Reversals for Dyslexia
description: For children who have dyslexia, this app helps with common letter and number reversals. There are a number of activities based around the common b-d reversals, the p-d-b reversals, and two games, where you can select from other letter or numbers and how they can be reversed (vertical or horizontal).

title: Adult Dyslexia
description:
Dyslexia has been described as a difficulty in processing information which may be linked to deficiencies in short-term memory and visual coordination. It is an inherent weakness in short-term memory, that is either auditory or visual, which can make it extremely difficult for that person to learn and understand the relation between symbols and spoken sounds.¬† This difficulty allows the person to be unable to correctly speak the correct flow of auditory sounds needed to make a word or sentence sound proper.

¬†

The range and severity of the problem of adult dyslexia varies widely between dyslexic people. The main areas of difficulty that occur most often are reading, writing, spelling, numeric, personal organization and time-keeping. However, the degree to which individuals may be affected ranges from mild spelling difficulties to severe organizational problems or complete illiteracy. In all reality there really is no such thing as a typical case of dyslexia.
Whether in work or college the best way to determine whether you are dyslexic or not is to obtain a formal assessment or test from your doctor.¬†

However, the degree to which individuals may be affected ranges from mild spelling difficulties to severe organizational problems or complete illiteracy. In all reality there really is no such thing as a typical case of dyslexia.
Whether in work or college the best way to determine whether you are dyslexic or not is to obtain a formal assessment or test from your doctor.¬†
summary: How Do I Know That I'm Dyslexic?

title: Omoguru - Dyslexia Friendly Reader
description:
Dyslexic students use Omoguru for fluency practice in an enjoyable way. The app supports school and independent reading needs of every dyslexic student ages 10 - 16 but also works great for adults.

What‚Äôs the secret? Visually comfortable font system and tools designed to make the text more readable. Research proves it reduces reading time, mistakes and mental effort. So far dyslexics read 150 000 pages with it. And it is free. 

"Fin loved the app, by the way. Is genuinely excited about it, and tried to use it to read a book this morning while we were asleep. Him wanting to read a book on his own is definitely a first, so thank you!‚Äù

Select a text from a preloaded library or add your own. The benefit the app provides is the ability to adjust the text and apply changes to the text which fit the reader's need perfectly.

This is how tools support finding what works best for you:

- Font Type - From A to E respectively longer letter ‚Äúnecks‚Äù and ‚Äútails‚Äù help to decode the words. 
- Syllables marking (with different colors) to keep reading rhythm
- Spacing between the lines and between the letters
- Weight of the font
- Font size
- The background color for better text 
- Marking mirror letters to avoid mental rotation

It usually takes under a minute to make these adjustments.

Select between two reading styles each with a tool that helps with focus and following lines.

The result of using Omoguru Reader is better fluency and reading skills. 

---------------------  

We do offer Omoguru Premium:

- Add an e-book or convert PDF, DocX, Mobi, Txt
- Convert a photo of the print to digital text and save it as a note

The current Omoguru Premium subscription is 4.49 USD/month or 42 USD/year. With a single account, Omoguru works on both smartphones and tablets.

title: Augmenta11y ‚Äì Dyslexia-friendly reading app
description:
Augmenta11y is the Augmented Reality powered smartphone app for those with dyslexia.

This app is backed by research and has been proven to show a 21% improvement in reading comprehension time when tested on students with dyslexia.

Augmenta11y is a one-stop platform that aims at making life easier on a regular basis, simplifying the process of interacting with objects and text-based data (such as billboards, street signs, hard copy documents, online data) that one may encounter with through the course of their day.

The app helps those with dyslexia absorb and interact with reading material with comfort. It provides a vast array of customizable options, rendering the text to be completely user-customizable based on their preferences. It serves as the ultimate assistant while dealing with the effects of a condition such as dyslexia.

It helps them be more independent, by ensuring ease of accessibility and usability. The application is fairly intuitive to use, simply point your device at the object at hand and let Augmenta11y work its magic.

Augmenta11y can assist you in the following ways:

User-Customization:

Font-size, font-style, text color, line-height ratio, text to background contrast and letter spacing are the few initial options provided. Find the combination of such adjustments that are tailored to aid you to consume real-world data better.

Read-Aloud:

To better understand the text at hand, Augmenta11y will assist you by reading the rendered data out loud to you!

History Log:

Augmenta11y will keep a close tab on all data encountered by you for future reference, allowing you to revisit it whenever required.

title: Speechify(Beta) Text To Speech PDF Reader Dyslexia
description:
Designed to help people with Dyslexia, ADD, Concussions, Second Language Learners, Auditory Learners, Super Learners and Productivity Fanatics.

Copy some text, open the app, and Speechify will read it to you with a human sounding voice. Turn your work/homework into a podcast.

Listen at up to 600 words per minute.

RETAIN MORE: Academic research shows that listening and reading at the same time results in significantly higher levels of comprehension AND an improvement in the listener‚Äôs reading speed even when not listening. 

Listen while driving, walking, cooking, eating, working out, etc.


Story 
I‚Äôve been dyslexic my whole life.

Reading that sentence takes me the same amount of time and brain energy as most people take when solving a 4 digit long division math equation in their head.

I would pretend to read in elementary school.

Through hard work (and convincing a lot teachers to give me exceptions) I got accepted to Brown University.

One problem....I couldn‚Äôt read my summer reading book - there was no audiobook for this book.

I had no other choice, I hacked an old text to speech computer system to read the remaining portion of the book over night into my iPhone and then listen to it on the plane.

Today, hundreds of thousands of people have been able to function in school and society because of Speechify.

Remember, that above all else, your mission is to be who you needed most when you were growing up.

Much love <3, Cliff Weitzman, Simeon Kostadinov and the rest of the Speechify Team

Go get the Mac App or Chrome Extension here: https://getspeechify.com/

We don‚Äôt allow new people to pay us right now. Want to pay us? Tell your friends about Speechify instead <3

comments: This app may turn out very usefull in the near future. But it requires a lot of bug fixes. Like for example, when I import a scanned documents and the code converts it from text to speech, there generally are changes I want to make in the text I imported. Hence, when I change the text the app is still reading out the unedited text. That needs to be fixed. But overall, this app is great but needs a lot of changes and improvements. Looking forward for a better version of this soon.

Ooooh my gosh, this needs a lot of work but it's already being promoted mindlessly in YouTube. Import does not support common eBook formats. You cannot select any TTS you download from other sources. Interface is too barebones. The only interesting feature is the automatic reading speed increase, but that is a paid feature. 50 bucks per year? Doesn't worth it for me guys, YET. I'm sticking with the app called @Voice. Great potential. Oh and I forgot that the notification bar is useless.

I know it's in Beta, if they do fix the bugs I will change my review, so the app does not work perfectly, the voices are the same as you get from other places, I sometimes use Google Assistant which just does sound better, the camera does not load, importing links sometimes works and sometimes does not, and I noticed that I used my Google Assistant to do a certain task, and they Speechify continued out of no where to resume it's playing. I really want this app to work, I hope you fix the bugs!! Would recommend for now checking out the Chrome Extension, that works just fine!

This app is useful, but it still has some stuff to fix. I decided to sign up for the free trial, and the premium voices did not load for me. Tried reinstalling the app, but that didn't work. Besides, it does not seem to be able to import Pocket lists, even though it's offered as a feature. This app sounds very promising, hope you can get it to work 100%. It's good but can be better.

Unfortunately, the android version does not have the same features as the ios counterpart. For instance, I cannot listen to all items of a list with a single keypress. I need to open all of them individually, which makes the app essentially worthless for hands-free usage.

title: Dyslexia Screening - Dyscreen
description:
Using cutting edge technology of Artificial Intelligence, Dyscreen allows fast and easy screening for Dyslexia and Motor Dysgraphia.

The screening is recommended for individuals aged 8 years old and over.

The Motor Dysgraphia screening only works for handwritten text with Roman alphabet.

For now, our Dyslexia screening is available for native English speakers, regardless of their accent.

Note: App is free to download and Includes in-app purchase for screening of  Dyslexia. Screening for Motor Dysgraphia is free.

title: Mighty Fonts (Sans Forgetica & Dyslexia fonts)
description:
This app allows you read and study with the help of 2 fonts. Sans Forgetica and Open Dyslexic. Simply select text and from context menu select "Mighty fonts". You can also paste stuff directly into the app from your clipboard. 


"Sans Forgetica is a font designed using the principles of cognitive psychology to help you to better remember your study notes. It was created by a multidisciplinary team of designers and behavioural scientists from RMIT University. (...) Sans Forgetica is more difficult to read than most typefaces ‚Äì and that‚Äôs by design. The 'desirable difficulty' you experience when reading information formatted in Sans Forgetica prompts your brain to engage in deeper processing."
Learn more about it at sansforgetica.rmit website.

"OpenDyslexic is a typeface designed against some common symptoms of dyslexia. If you like the way you are able to read this page, and others, then this typeface is for you!
OpenDyslexic is not supposed to be a cure, a complete solution, or something you should apply uniformly to everyone: it was intended to address: contrast/blindness, letter confusion or rotation, and crowding."
Learn more about it at opendyslexic.org website.

comments: Very thankful for this app! I don't have dyslexia, but my ADHD symptoms make reading electronically very difficult. Until I found this app I had been using the OpenDyslexic extension on desktop but was out of luck for reading on mobile. This app solves that issue for me and has made reading on my phone much easier! The interface is very straightforward to use and offers contrast settings so you don't have to read black and white. (I would love if a sepia option was added in the future!)

it is okay, but i expected to be able to install the fonts in my phone to have it in constant use. perhaps being a bit more clear in the description might help some people understand its purpose in first sight?
Nice I use it for the sans Forgetica, however I find that when I turn to landscape mode, it changes my text settings all up and stays that way. Besides that, it's a little basic on other functions.
font size changes with the rotation of the screen, it's so annoying having to redo the screen size Everytime you rotate the screen or do a split screen.
this app lives up to its promises but what I really want is an app that can convert the phones default font settings to 'open dyslexia' and "sans forgeta'.

title: Dunking Dyslexia
description:
Dunking Dyslexia helps with reading, writing, spelling, pronunciation, and speech for
those with learning challenges, on the autism spectrum, in speech classes and in ELD
classes. It‚Äôs combining music with spelling, music played in the left ear and spelling in
the right ear. The spelling words progress in difficulty per lesson starting with 3 letter
words, to 4 letter words. Then advancing to 2 syllable words and then and two words
that typically go together. Sentences follow with progression of difficulty as well
corresponding to phonics lessons in the Step By Step Reading program.
This is a multi sensory approach to teaching and learning phonics using music and is
based on neuroscience of the relationship of music to learning. The app is an optional
component to the Step By Step Reading program created by Dr. Marianne Cintron. You
may contact Dr. Cintron on her website: https://www.stepbystepdyslexiasolutions.com.
This app requires internet connection and is divided into three subgroups. It is designed
for families. Parents download the app for 7 years or older. Music is always played in
the LEFT ear and spelling exercises (if desired) in the RIGHT ear. The music itself is
great for listening and impacts the brain in beneficial ways.
For each button, students tap the button to begin the exercise, which can be
paused, rewound, or fast forwarded as the student desires using the back, pause,
and forward arrows < = >.
Subgroup 1a: There are two basic exercises at the top, that when tapped, will begin.
Exercise 1 contains music only, to be played in the LEFT ear via ear pod, allowing the
student to listen while focusing on reading the phonics or completing workbook pages.
Exercise 2 is letter names and sound for students at any age who need that support.
Subgroup 2: There are 28 spelling exercises that correspond to the Step By Step
Reading program. Students listen with ear pods so that music is played in the LEFT ear
while the spelling exercises are listened to in the RIGHT ear.
Subgroup 3: There are 8 spelling sentence groups that correspond to the Step-By Step
Reading program. Students listen with ear pods so that music is played in the LEFT ear
while the spelling exercises are listened to in the RIGHT ear.
Page 2
Why This App Is Unique
MUSIC IS USED TO HELP WITH READING, SPELLING, WRITING AND SPEAKING!

Dr. Cintron‚Äôs Step By Step Reading program was created with the dyslexic student in
mind in order to use the music. Music is being used in many situations for students on
the autism spectrum, and for elderly with dementia and Alzheimer.
Please email Dr. Cintron at https:www.stepbystepdyselxiasolutions.com.
Page 3
About the Author
Dr. Marianne Cintron has a Doctorate of Education in Leadership and Administration,
has a Masters in General Education and one in Special Education, and has two
California Teaching Credentials. She is a Dyslexia Specialist, President of Step By Step
Dyslexia Solutions, and a National Trainer. She has twenty years of experience in
Education, ten years as a Classroom Teacher, is an Author, App Developer, and
Curriculum Writer.
After teaching in several districts, she left the school system to have a greater reach
and to help teachers learn about teaching dyslexic students. She is currently a board
member of the International Dyslexia Association‚ÄìTri County Branch, a member of the
Pomona Chamber of Commerce, and Secretary of Christian Business Partners in
Glendora. She is the only educator using music with her reading program to effectively
help dyslexic students improve in reading at a profound rate.

descriptionHTML:
Dunking Dyslexia helps with reading, writing, spelling, pronunciation, and speech for
those with learning challenges, on the autism spectrum, in speech classes and in ELD
classes. It‚Äôs combining music with spelling, music played in the left ear and spelling in
the right ear. The spelling words progress in difficulty per lesson starting with 3 letter
words, to 4 letter words. Then advancing to 2 syllable words and then and two words
that typically go together. Sentences follow with progression of difficulty as well
corresponding to phonics lessons in the Step By Step Reading program.
This is a multi sensory approach to teaching and learning phonics using music and is
based on neuroscience of the relationship of music to learning. The app is an optional
component to the Step By Step Reading program created by Dr. Marianne Cintron. You
may contact Dr. Cintron on her website: https://www.stepbystepdyslexiasolutions.com.
This app requires internet connection and is divided into three subgroups. It is designed
for families. Parents download the app for 7 years or older. Music is always played in
the LEFT ear and spelling exercises (if desired) in the RIGHT ear. The music itself is
great for listening and impacts the brain in beneficial ways.

title: Ridit - for Dyslexic Readers
description:
Ridit is an app that lets you customize any text to your own preference. Designed to help people with Dyslexia and other reading difficulties.


Take a picture of any printed or hand-written text with the camera or copy text into the app and choose between many dyslexia-friendly fonts and color contrasts. Control and improve your reading speed with our word-by-word methodology.


Open up your eyes to a new reading experience!

recentChanges: Fix translation in spanish
comments: I love this app but I'd like there to be a feature that just converts the text to Opendyslexic and a larger font rather than reading it one word at a time. I also really wish there was a way to upload a picture into the app. I've had to use another app to convert an uploaded picture to text and then paste it into this app and it's pretty annoying.

It is a really smart idea. But i would actually like to be abel to read the text i take i picture of in open dyslexic as in on 1 page instead of it shows one word at the time. I find that really annoying. Like if i need to read a recipe i can't see the all just one word at the time. If that happens i would give it 5 starts
What? I wanted an app that could turn blocks of text into dyslexic sympathetic fonts. You can't just copy and paste text and then read it it's just a teleprompter. Not useful!!

title: Percival's Help For Dyslexia
description:
Percival‚Äôs Help For Dyslexia - Say goodbye to pepul, cud and sevun!

Has your child been diagnosed with dyslexia? Are they struggling to learn the spellings they are set by their school? Are you looking for a way to help them that you can enjoy together? Why not try Percival‚Äôs Help For Dyslexia? Suddenly, "nite" becomes Night Is Good Howling Time and "sevun" becomes Seven Evil Vampires Eat Nuggets!

Percival‚Äôs Help For Dyslexia, also known as Percival's Essential Spellings, has been specifically designed to help children who have dyslexia. This includes the ability to alter the colour of the screen and wording to suit their needs for colour contrasts, caused by the often linked condition of "visual stress". 

The Professor focuses on 107 common words that you can‚Äôt make with letter sounds, but which are commonly used in everyday life, such as days of the week, colours, months of the year, connectives, pronouns etc. He gives your child ways to remember these tricky words including: 

Mnemonics
Chants
Animations
Hand and body movements 

Plus, the Professor has packed in loads of colourful cartoons that will stick in your child‚Äôs mind.  There are also the hilarious ‚Äúfridge safety tips‚Äù‚Ä¶  You never know what is lurking and pulling the strange man in!

Developed by a leading English primary school teacher, and outstanding Special Needs Assistant, Percival‚Äôs Help For Dyslexia is used in schools throughout the United Kingdom to teach children of all ages with spelling difficulties. It is ideal for children who are finding the traditional "look, cover, write, check" and "synthetic phonics" approaches that are used in schools ineffective. 

Ultimately, Percival‚Äôs Help For Dyslexia is a fun activity where you can work with your child to help them learn the spellings they are going to need throughout their lives. It is bound to appeal to your child and will make the learning of spellings more interesting and entertaining.

LEARN MORE: https://www.keystoneeducation.co.uk/parents/

title: TintVision
description:
TintVision is a free app intended to improve user experience for people, primarily with dyslexia, and other vision impairments by providing a colour overlay and draggable underliner tool. Unlike other apps which allow you to overlay the screen with a coloured filter, TintVision is designed with accessibility in mind.

The user interface has been specifically created to make it as easy as possible for dyslexic users to navigate and use, making use of a high constrast colour scheme and "dyslexic friendly font" (OpenDyslexic 3).

TintVision was created after thorough research for a final year University project and is subject to continual updates.

Developer: Edward McKnight BSc ICTTech TMIET (EM-Creations.co.uk)
Logo design: Lorna Bunnie

recentChanges:
- Basic translations added for French, German, Spanish and Scottish Gaelic
- If permission to draw over apps when the app is first launched is denied, users will be asked again when trying to turn on the overlay or underliner
- Back-end code restructuring
comments: The app is really simple to use: just two modes, a colour overlay and an underliner that can be used simultaneously. The latter is a little jerky, presumably because the app underneath is competing for clicks and drags.

Fantastic app. Can sometimes just turn off. However generally reliable and incredibly useful for making reading on my phone easier. I'm amazed that this function isn't built into Android. The app would be improved if there was a way of only having the tint working in certain apps. For example whilst reading email it is excellent, however when looking at photographs I need to turn tint off.

PLEASE MAKE THIS APP AVAILABLE FOR iPhones. This app is wonderful for people recovering from concussions who have light sensitivity and eye strain with screens. It enables you to choose the color, transparency of the color, and the size of the colored overlay on your device screen. It also provides a line to help keep your place with reading. However, I have two suggestions - the line needs to be easier to place/move on the page and PLEASE MAKE THIS APP AVAILABLE FOR iPhones. There is nothing like it for apple users and people really need it!

I love this app. I have severe visual impairments and this has made using my phone a lot easier. You also get loads of colour options. The only issue is that for me it is a little too light I need something a little more opaque.
This is really goo it helps me, irh my visual stress I got this nez phone not able to change it to purple and getting really bad mine grains bit it works amazing

title: Spell 4 You
description:
Spell 4 You is a spelling application which works with voice recognition. I designed this for a friend with severe dyslexia. You Click the button "Spell it" then wait until it beeps and say your word. It will then show your word while telling you how it is spelt.

This app is completely free because I believe this is for a good cause.

In a future update it will give you the definition of the word.

its a good help
they read it to fast

This app has been useful however I cannot give it 5‚òÜ due to it does not pick up all of my words I'm trying to spell due to my disabilities.  I have difficulty in saying words I'm trying to spell. There are several other points this app could improve on. 1) to be able to save the words once spelled to keep in a library. 2) to copy and paste. 3) to have better voice recognition to deal with dyspraxia . Otherwise it's simple to work and helpful just wish could save the words to keep as a record.

I never leave reviews but  this app is BRILLIANT.  It's shockingly accurate, high quality and its perfect for          adults and kids with dyslexia. Thank you for making this available at no cost because of the NEED. I'll definitely be telling all the members of our online dyslexia support group           about this awesome app that comes from the heart. Thank you.

title: Ultimate Phonics Reading App
description:
This app is a must-try for parents, teachers, and tutors who teach reading to students of any age. It is also excellent for self-study to improve reading and English pronunciation.

Ultimate Phonics is useful in any situation where reading is taught:

* Beginning Readers

Did you know that many children never become good readers? Reading is the most important skill for education and success. If you have young children first learning to read, you can give them the gift that lasts a lifetime by teaching them with Ultimate Phonics. Just an hour per week can make a huge improvement in their reading ability.

* Struggling Readers

Do you have children or students who guess and skip when they read? Did you know that word guessing causes poor reading comprehension and terrible spelling? Relying on word guessing prevents students from becoming good readers and cripples their education.

A good reader reads by rapidly and accurately sounding out new words. That is exactly what Ultimate Phonics teaches. It develops your students into more accurate, fluent readers with good reading comprehension.

* Dyslexia and Orton-Gillingham

Ultimate Phonics is very effective for teaching dyslexics to read. The app can be used either by itself or as a supplement for Orton-Gillingham programs or other programs designed to overcome dyslexia.

If you are an Orton-Gillingham teacher, you will love this app. It has excellent word lists and decodable sentences, all broken down and sounded out. The app also has a Find feature that lets you look up lessons matching any phonogram in a matter of seconds. This app is a great supplement to any Orton-Gillingham program and is guaranteed to become a useful tool in your teaching toolkit.

* Adult Literacy

Adult learners love the design of the program because it teaches them to read clearly and directly, without insulting them. And tutors love Ultimate Phonics because it's easy to use and produces great results. Try it for yourself and see why Ultimate Phonics is an essential teaching tool for any adult literacy situation.

* ESL and English Pronunciation

ESL (English as a Second Language) students need to learn to read English at the same time they are learning to speak it. Ultimate Phonics effectively improves reading, spelling, and pronunciation for ESL students of all ages.

If you are a student learning English, you can use Ultimate Phonics to help with both your reading and your pronunciation. The app breaks down thousands of words and sentences by their individual speech sounds, so you learn in detail how to pronounce words more accurately.

*** CONTENT

The complete program consists of more than 4,400 words and 2,100 sentences organized into 262 lessons. The lessons are grouped into 12 levels, teaching the entire phonics system of English.

You get the first level (lessons 1 to 50) for free. You have the option of purchasing additional levels one at a time or purchasing all the levels at once at a discount.

Here is a summary of the topics in each level:

* LEVEL 1 (Lessons 1 to 50)
Simple words with short vowels, single consonants, and consonant blends.

* LEVEL 2 (Lessons 51 to 80)
Consonant digraphs (sh, ch, th, wh, ck), qu, x, ng and nk patterns, and doubled consonants.

* LEVEL 3 (Lessons 81 to 106)
Vowel digraphs (ee, ea, oo, ai, ay, oa, ou, ow, aw, au, oy, oi).

* LEVEL 4 (Lessons 107 to 124)
Endings (s, es, ed, ing, ful), apostrophes and more.

* LEVEL 5 (Lessons 125 to 147)
Syllables, compound words, and multi-syllable words.

* LEVEL 6 (Lessons 148 to 155)
Soft c and g patterns.

* LEVEL 7 (Lessons 156 to 171)
Long vowels in magic e syllables.

* LEVEL 8 (Lessons 172 to 183)
Long vowels in open syllables.

* LEVEL 9 (Lessons 184 to 209)
22 more long vowel patterns.

* LEVEL 10 (Lessons 210 to 225)
R-controlled vowels (ar, er, ir, or, ur, and more).

* LEVEL 11 (Lessons 226 to 239)
13 more short vowel patterns.

* LEVEL 12 (Lessons 240 to 262)
Silent letters and advanced patterns.

A good reader reads by rapidly and accurately sounding out new words. That is exactly what Ultimate Phonics teaches. It develops your students into more accurate, fluent readers with good reading comprehension.

* Dyslexia and Orton-Gillingham

Ultimate Phonics is very effective for teaching dyslexics to read. The app can be used either by itself or as a supplement for Orton-Gillingham programs or other programs designed to overcome dyslexia.

If you are an Orton-Gillingham teacher, you will love this app. It has excellent word lists and decodable sentences, all broken down and sounded out. The app also has a Find feature that lets you look up lessons matching any phonogram in a matter of seconds. This app is a great supplement to any Orton-Gillingham program and is guaranteed to become a useful tool in your teaching toolkit.

* Adult Literacy

Adult learners love the design of the program because it teaches them to read clearly and directly, without insulting them. And tutors love Ultimate Phonics because it's easy to use and produces great results. Try it for yourself and see why Ultimate Phonics is an essential teaching tool for any adult literacy situation.

* ESL and English Pronunciation

ESL (English as a Second Language) students need to learn to read English at the same time they are learning to speak it. Ultimate Phonics effectively improves reading, spelling, and pronunciation for ESL students of all ages.

If you are a student learning English, you can use Ultimate Phonics to help with both your reading and your pronunciation. The app breaks down thousands of words and sentences by their individual speech sounds, so you learn in detail how to pronounce words more accurately.

*** CONTENT

The complete program consists of more than 4,400 words and 2,100 sentences organized into 262 lessons. The lessons are grouped into 12 levels, teaching the entire phonics system of English.

You get the first level (lessons 1 to 50) for free. You have the option of purchasing additional levels one at a time or purchasing all the levels at once at a discount.

Here is a summary of the topics in each level:

* LEVEL 1 (Lessons 1 to 50)
Simple words with short vowels, single consonants, and consonant blends.

* LEVEL 2 (Lessons 51 to 80)
Consonant digraphs (sh, ch, th, wh, ck), qu, x, ng and nk patterns, and doubled consonants.

* LEVEL 3 (Lessons 81 to 106)
Vowel digraphs (ee, ea, oo, ai, ay, oa, ou, ow, aw, au, oy, oi).

* LEVEL 4 (Lessons 107 to 124)
Endings (s, es, ed, ing, ful), apostrophes and more.

* LEVEL 5 (Lessons 125 to 147)
Syllables, compound words, and multi-syllable words.

* LEVEL 6 (Lessons 148 to 155)
Soft c and g patterns.

* LEVEL 7 (Lessons 156 to 171)
Long vowels in magic e syllables.

* LEVEL 8 (Lessons 172 to 183)
Long vowels in open syllables.

* LEVEL 9 (Lessons 184 to 209)
22 more long vowel patterns.

* LEVEL 10 (Lessons 210 to 225)
R-controlled vowels (ar, er, ir, or, ur, and more).

* LEVEL 11 (Lessons 226 to 239)
13 more short vowel patterns.

* LEVEL 12 (Lessons 240 to 262)
Silent letters and advanced patterns.
summary: Improves reading, spelling, and English pronunciation for all ages

title: Dyslexia: Causes, Diagnosis, and Management
description:
Dyslexia, also known as reading disorder, is characterized by trouble with reading despite normal intelligence. Different people are affected to varying degrees. Problems may include difficulties in spelling words, reading quickly, writing words, "sounding out" words in the head, pronouncing words when reading aloud and understanding what one reads. Often these difficulties are first noticed at school. When someone who previously could read loses their ability, it is known as alexia. The difficulties are involuntary and people with this disorder have a normal desire to learn. 
Dyslexia is believed to be caused by both genetic and environmental factors. Some cases run in families. It often occurs in people with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and is associated with similar difficulties with numbers. It may begin in adulthood as the result of a traumatic brain injury, stroke, or dementia. The underlying mechanisms of dyslexia are problems within the brain's language processing. Dyslexia is diagnosed through a series of tests of memory, spelling, vision, and reading skills. Dyslexia is separate from reading difficulties caused by hearing or vision problems or by insufficient teaching. 
==========================
APP FEATURES
==========================
This exclusive app will help to understand the Dyslexia symptoms, Dyslexia Management, Dyslexia causes, Dyslexia diagnosis, Dyslexia Prognosis, Dyslexia Epidemiology and history. 
Here are features that make this app better than all other Dyslexia Disease apps - 
-	UI of app is very user responsive and easy to navigate. 
-	Easily Change the page.
-	Data of app is collected from various research reports.
-	You can access these favorites whenever you want.
-	Share your favorite benefits with your friends and family through email, SMS, Twitter, Facebook, and WhatsApp.

All these features are available for free.

title: HexaDyslexia
description: Reading affects almost all other learning processes. But between 5-15% of the world‚Äôs population suffers from Dyslexia. More reading is done every day on screens and devices, so work has naturally been done changing background, font and font color. These increase fluency for about 17% of Dyslexics. HexaDyslexia does that, AND ALSO changes the color of every letter. This may disrupt misinterpretations in the cerebellum. (This is theory; but our research says it increases fluency for ~60% of Dyslexics.) The prototype is an app. We want to implement it as a browser plugin, and on the OS level.

title: KOBI - Helps Children Read
description:
[ Dyslexia Awareness Month ] Kobi Forever [30% OFF] until the end of October. Grab the unlimited license at a discounted price.

EVIDENCE-BASED SOLUTION Daily reading practice is crucial for the development of reading skills. With KOBI reading is enjoyable even for struggling readers. 

If your child has dyslexia than he probably does not like reading that much. With Kobi, this will change! There will be:
 
- no more reversing letters
- easier blending and decoding
- improved reading accuracy & rate 

RESULTING IN:
Better fluency, comprehension, and boosted MOTIVATION!
 
Kobi introduces an innovative way of formatting text that has been developed by designers and recommended by professionals working in Feducation. The application was tested by over 100 educators with over 500 children dealing with reading difficulties. 94,62% of children have confirmed - Kobi helps them read!
 
MOTIVATION
Motivation is key to a successful learning session. When a child is motivated, he or she can face any obstacle, solve any problem or climb any kitchen cabinet. Kobi was designed so it keeps the child motivated for the duration of the session and beyond.
 
READING ACCURACY
Reading Accuracy is one of two main ingredients of Reading Fluency. With Reading Accuracy, Reading Comprehension increases as well. Kobi‚Äôs features were designed with this in mind and allow personalization to suit your child‚Äôs needs.
 
READING RATE
Reading Rate is the second ingredient for Reading Fluency. Because Kobi structures texts so it is easy to read, the child‚Äôs Reading Rate increases dramatically.
 
READING OF LONG, COMPLICATED WORDS
Long, complicated words can be a real obstacle when learning to read. Demotivation and frustration are the usual outcomes when a dyslexic child is unable to read a word successfully and then the learning stops. By breaking down the text into comprehensive parts, Kobi helps your child reading those complicated words and the fun can continue.
 
With Kobi, you can adjust and save settings for multiple children, organize the reading library, scan any book or import materials.
 
Kobi was validated by professional educators who confirmed, the application indeed helps children, affected by dyslexia and other struggling readers. The mobile app uses a combination of existing proven methods in combat against dyslexia, coupled with an innovative approach tested by specialists and approved by dyslexic children who are learning to read. 

Some of the Features:

KOBIFICATION
Kobification is an innovative method designed by a mother of a dyslexic child. Her daughter was battling with severe dyslexia until her mother came up with a coloring solution that worked like a charm. The method was tested and has a proven record of helping more than 500 children who are struggling to learn to read because of dyslexia.

PERSONALIZATION
No child is the same as the next one. Kobi allows for personalization of every single feature in the app, including the library, the texts, colors, fonts, font sizes, line spacing, and background colors. This allows children to learn to read in their own way!

ONLINE LIBRARY
Kobi comes preloaded with a huge collection of dyslexia friendly books. No more struggling to find appropriate content, with Kobi you can have a new book in front of your child with a single click.

BOOK SCANNER
Want to read a specific book? You can do that too! Simply scan the book with the integrated book scanner and replace the boring physical black and white text with colorful dyslexia-friendly kobified letters.

FOCUS FRAME
Focus Frame is one of those absolutely necessary tools for children, who easily lose focus. Focus Frame shows only the word that is supposed to be in focus and hide the content around it.

Read more about the mobile app: https://kobiapp.io

title: SmartyNote Notepad : A Smart Notepad for Dyslexia
description:
Take notes quick & easy!

Smartynote is a notepad app with multiple features to making it easy to take daily notes. From regular students to the kids & adults struggling with reading and writing difficulty like dyslexia, this Notepad is for everyone. Our Notepad is equipped with powerful functions that allows you to take notes in just secs. This app is based on Orton Gillingham approach and is powered by Numberdyslexia.com which serves best content on dyslexia and dyscalculia

Smartynote notepad features include :

1. Image-to-text (ocr) : Smartynote notepad allows you to either take a picture from the camera or choose an image from your smartphone gallery,which then extract the text & save it to the notepad directly. Smartynote notepad uses google vision api to recognize text in an image, which is still improving its intelligence.

2. Voice recognition : This notepad can recognize your voice and extract text from it to auto-save it to your note. This is a perfect for those who don't want to write down the words, instead want the notepad to do it for them. Wanna do quick interviews? Our voice notepad app is perfect for you!

3. Text-to-speech : This function is found to be very useful for the people having difficulty manipulating words as in dyslexia. In just a tap, a sweet lady will loudly dictates the text already written in the notepad. Latest update of our notepad app will automatically picks up the device default languange and speak with the best pronunciation provided in that language by the google voice assistance, but please make sure you have the necessary language package installed already in your device for your voice recognition and text to speech.

4. Customization : Notepad enables you to choose font, font size, font color & background color according to your preference. The color and the fonts that are made available in the app are handpicked according to the utmost assistance to the kids and adults with dyslexia. This notepad have dyslexia fonts, specially for kids and adults with dyslexia

5. Disable ads easily : We know that you don't want ads and that is why, smartynote allows you to disable ads easily by providing Ads Switch. Just turn it off to disable ads. 

How to extract text from image in this notepad?

1. While taking note, tap at the 'Image-to-text'.
2. Allow the necessary permissions
3. Choose either camera (to take picture from camera) or gallery (to select image from gallery)
4. After choosing image,the app  will take image  for cropping 
5. After cropping, tap at the 'crop' clickable text at top-right.
6. That's it, the notepad will display the text on the note.

Please note :

1. Image-to-text (ocr) uses google vision intelligence which is still improving. Thus, have limitations while recognizing text from image. It may interpret some alphabet differently than that available in the image.

2. Try to focus on one paragraph instead of an whole page for accurate results.

3. Handwritten text is not recognizable.


How to write note from my voice in the notepad?

1. While on second screen, tap at the 'Speech-to-text'
2. Make sure the internet is on.
3. When google dialog appears, speak 
4. Wait for the app to process your voice 
5. That' it.

How to change the language for voice recognition?

1. Go to the 'settings' app of your android smartphone.
2. Tap on 'Language & input', then tap on 'Language'
3. Choose your desired language.

How to dictate the note?

1. While on second screen, tap on 'Text-to-speech'
2. That' it, A lady will dictate the words written in the note.

How to edit & delete notes?

All the saved notepad notes are displayed as a list on the home screen. On each list item note, there is a provision for two  image button, one for editing note (displayed as black pen at the left side) & other for deleting note (displayed as black recycle bin at the right side).

title: iDyslexic
description: Creating an Ideal Environment for students with Dyslexia to grow and flourish, The first social and interactive mobile app to make the connection between Parents, Students, Teachers and caseworkers thru the in app creation of Secure Classroom Portals allowing all members communicate in a secure manner, create homework schedule, use classroom group chat, Upload IEP reports. iDyslexic is the missing link that opens the lines of communication to help in all aspects of a students education. Outside of your secure classroom you will find the iDyslexic community where sharing in key whether posting to the iDyslexic feed, Finding new friends just like you on GeoMapping, Sharing your story with the community or gaining insightful advise from or industry mentors .

title: Sight Words Sentence Builder: Reading for Kids
description:
Did you know that automatic recognition of Sight Words is an essential part of functional literacy? This fun game covers all levels of Dolch Sight Words and lets students practice them in context. 

The game is fun and simple. Using grade appropriate Sight Words, children assemble short sentences from given words.  The player receives visual and auditory feedback indicating whether the response is correct. Once the student answers correctly, the exercise moves to the next sentence.

- Top-rated Sight Words game
- More than 100 example sentences
- Teaches all 220 Dolch Sight Words in context
- Fun and colorful graphics
- Visual and auditory feedback
- Three visual themes

title: Speed Reader for Dyslexics App
description:
No more worrying about those important emails or having to worry if you are reading something right. Our App can make it easier for you to be able to understand these. Just paste your text or email into the box and let our App do the rest.

This App can help to make reading easier if you struggle to read words in a sentence. It has been designed to reduce the clutter around the words in a sentence.

You can set it up so that it can fit for needs perfectly. There are options for changing text and also the speed of the app so it can be used in comfort.

title: Hairy Phonics-1
description:
The ideal app to follow the award-winning Hairy Letters. 

Hairy Phonics develops phonemic awareness with the introduction of the 9 most common consonant digraphs. This is where two consonants join and make one sound. 

-	Learn 9 phonemes (sounds): sh, ch, th, ck, ff, ll, ss, zz, ng.
-	Guides your child through a structured sequence of learning.
-	Phonic animations link an action with the sound.
-	Trace the letters with your finger.
-	Play games to blend the phonemes into a whole word and improve understanding
-	Sound out words and understand how the phoneme changes the sound of the word
-	Save all the Hairies and see them dance.

This is a particularly important skill for those with dyslexia. 
Designed for 4-6 year olds. 
This app is strictly educational and has no in-app purchases. 

**************************************************************
REVIEWS
**************************************************************


This is a really great app my son loves it.  All the Nessy products are amazing and my son thinks it's such a funny game, so learning and laughing fab. ‚Äì 100CoolCat

My kids loved the first Hairy app and were excited to play this one. It didn't disappoint as they really enjoyed it. It has a different game to the first one where you build a word for the Hairy guy to slide over.  ‚Äì OJRocks

- Guides your child through a structured sequence of learning.
- Phonic animations link an action with the sound.
- Trace the letters with your finger.
- Play games to blend the phonemes into a whole word and improve understanding
- Sound out words and understand how the phoneme changes the sound of the word
- Save all the Hairies and see them dance.

This is a particularly important skill for those with dyslexia.
Designed for 4-6 year olds.
This app is strictly educational and has no in-app purchases.

**************************************************************
REVIEWS
**************************************************************


This is a really great app my son loves it. All the Nessy products are amazing and my son thinks it's such a funny game, so learning and laughing fab. ‚Äì 100CoolCat

My kids loved the first Hairy app and were excited to play this one. It didn't disappoint as they really enjoyed it. It has a different game to the first one where you build a word for the Hairy guy to slide over. ‚Äì OJRocks

title: Read&Write for Android
description:
Boost confidence and attainment for dyslexic and ESL students who struggle with reading and writing.
 
Read&Write for Android is an easy to use alternative keyboard with integrated features to help you with writing content such as emails, social media, or interacting with online forms etc. Specially created for Android tablets, it‚Äôs great for anyone who needs a little support with their reading and writing.

With ‚Äòspeak as I type‚Äô and specially formulated dyslexia focused word prediction and dictionaries, this keyboard makes typing any content on a tablet simple and fast.

When editing content, simply touch a word, sentence or whole passage and hear it read out loud. Use the dictionaries and other tools to assist with essays, assignments or general reading and writing.

This touch-focused version of the world‚Äôs best-selling literacy software family is great for self-study at home, and in classrooms with BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) strategies. 

Read&Write boosts confidence and attainment for struggling readers and everyone who‚Äôs improving their English ‚Äì including students with learning difficulties, dyslexia or ESL.

Key features:*

‚Ä¢ Touch and hold to hear text read aloud with easy-to-follow on-screen highlighting
‚Ä¢ Speak As I Type
‚Ä¢ Word prediction
‚Ä¢ Talking Dictionary and Picture Dictionary for use in any writing app
‚Ä¢ Spell checker
 
* This trial version of Read&Write for Android supports all features described above for a period of 30 days.
 
Contact Texthelp for more information on Read&Write licensing and pricing information for schools and colleges.

comments: Absolutely frustrating every time I use it I faff around with it for about 10 minutes to get it to actually work instead of reading buttons and URLS and then it will either crash/freeze my computer. If you'e been recommended this because of you're AD(H)D I would not recommend, all it will do is demotivate and frustrate you that you will not get any work done. Funnily enough this is the most productive the app has made me since installing it. I've fiddled around with settings, youtube tutorials and it is still as disappointing and painful since opening it.
Cannot get the app to work. Keyboard keeps crashing so unable to use the app at all. No support found online either which is a shame as it would be useful to have on my tablet.

Its installed I opened a google chrome page assuming that this extension would be in the available at the top of the page, but I don't see it. I can't figure out howbto retrieve it. Also the apps keyboard doenst have good auto spell, it very easy to type typos, and the keys vibrate when you type which is annoying.
App does not respond ,which inturn causes my keybord to malfunction since you control it through the keyboard. Sadily it costs money and the app is useless if this is not addressed.
It does not work on my tablet. Whenever I open the app it goes to the writing option screen.... and that's it. So it's a waste of time and money since I'm paying for it out of my tuition.

title: VR In the shoes of a child with Dyslexia
description:
Virtual reality has a clear impact when it comes to developing emotions, especially Empathy. It is able to  immerse you into someone else‚Äôs situation.

We have developed this project with the objective of sensibilizing children, teachers and parents about Dyslexia. It affects around 10% of the children in the world, interfering with reading, writing abilities and even sometimes their speech. This project aims to help create a more inclusive environment.

Our app simulates a situation where a child has dyslexia. First we see the classroom and then we visit the home environment. We get to see different points of view showing the learning difficulties and frustrations they go through.,

Requirements:
Version minimum system: Android 4.4. It is necessary to have a mobile phone with a gyroscope and a Virtual Reality headset.There is no need for a remote. It is advised to use a phone that is considered medium or high range.

title: Dyslexia Disease
description: Dyslexia, also known as reading disorder, is characterized by trouble with reading despite normal intelligence. Different people are affected to varying degrees. Problems may include difficulties in spelling words, reading quickly, writing words, "sounding out" words in the head, pronouncing words when reading aloud and understanding what one reads. Often these difficulties are first noticed at school. When someone who previously could read loses their ability, it is known as alexia. The difficulties are involuntary and people with this disorder have a normal desire to learn. Dyslexia is believed to be caused by both genetic and environmental factors. Some cases run in families. It often occurs in people with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and is associated with similar difficulties with numbers. It may begin in adulthood as the result of a traumatic brain injury, stroke, or dementia. The underlying mechanisms of dyslexia are problems within the brain's language processing. Dyslexia is diagnosed through a series of tests of memory, spelling, vision, and reading skills. Dyslexia is separate from reading difficulties caused by hearing or vision problems or by insufficient teaching.

comments: I rate this app 5 stars because its an amazing app and its a must have app to own, plus its free. Its full of knowledge, support and self awareness. Its very easy to use and gives you direct straightforward questions and answers. You will never regret downloading it. I highly recommend this app to anyone who needs it. Its a very useful and helpful app tool. It'll give you a more a positive view of yourself and of your mental state. A hugh thankyou to the creators, especially for allowing it free

Was diagnosed by a mental health professional before & this apps tests results were right on which, for such complicated issues, was very surprising. It's a great start for someone who is wanting to know these things

I like how every area of this app is straight forward; even the questionnaire is direct and effective. There are SEVERAL DIFFERENT topics to √™xplore! The results, advice and resources are kept simple and to the point! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED app! I always inform friends or acquaintance of this awesome app!

I have shared it with friends already. It's great. Retake tests compare the results to each one. Keeps a journal. Very handy and if your just starting to seek medical help it can also help them having a result history to look at. Would like it to have an overall test with X amount of questions from all tests to better narrow down to few results. Or option to take actual medical professional tests.
This is stupid....I can't even use it because it won't freaking load! My service is good, so I don't see why the app isn't usable....üôÑüòë

title: ADHD Test
description:
Do you find it hard to concentrate? Do you feel the need to move constantly or interrupt others? If these issues are negatively impacting your daily life, this could be a sign of ADHD (Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder). While ADHD symptoms typically begin in childhood, ADHD can continue through adolescence and adulthood.

This ADHD Test is designed to help you screen yourself for the possibility of ADHD with just six simple questions. This app uses the Adult ADHD Self-Report Scale. 

Disclaimer: This test is NOT applicable to children and is also NOT a diagnostic test. Please consult your physician if you are concerned about ADHD.
descriptionHTML:
Do you find it hard to concentrate? Do you feel the need to move constantly or interrupt others? If these issues are negatively impacting your daily life, this could be a sign of ADHD (Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder). While ADHD symptoms typically begin in childhood, ADHD can continue through adolescence and adulthood.

This ADHD Test is designed to help you screen yourself for the possibility of ADHD with just six simple questions. This app uses the Adult ADHD Self-Report Scale.

Disclaimer: This test is NOT applicable to children and is also NOT a diagnostic test. Please consult your physician if you are concerned about ADHD.
summary: Evaluate your symptoms of Adult ADHD with a simple, validated screening test.

30 N Gould St Ste 11721
Sheridan, WY 82801
recentChanges: Minor optimizations and improvements.
comments: if someone put very often for all of the questions and the app told them they had adhd, it doesn't mean they do. i was diagnosed by doctors for adhd and adhd is much more than procrastinating, not focusing and fidgeting. plus, there are only 5 questions. i dont reccomend getting this app. go to doctors instead. (DONT self-diagnose !!!)
Simple questionnaire, nothing more than a preliminary questionnaire. Had an issue of test display on one question

Hi developer, I'm pretty sure you are making affiliate commissions from those links in your app for therapy after you ask 5 questions. Sometimes the concept of getting users help is good but misdiagnosing them can lead them to the wrong path Some minds are very fragile. I have A. D. H. D and it feels this app is mocking the concept of it as joke with just 5Qs.
Five questions? This does not even begin to touch ADHD
Its not cool to give false hope bro, makung people think you've diagnosed em and they should receive help quick, this app is fake.

title: Rivet: Better Reading Practice For Kids
description:
Rivet is a fun and supportive reading app for kids. With 3,500+ free books at just the right level, quality reading practice for your kids has never been easier. 

Additionally, reading support on every page enables kids to practice with confidence knowing help is always available - it is a great way to meet daily reading goals!


Features:
- 3,500+ free, leveled children‚Äôs books
- 8 reading levels to grow with your reader
- Engaging, kid-friendly interface
- Tap on tricky words for help
- Rate, review, and save favorite books
- Browse categories or search by keyword
- Read books from your favorite YouTube creators
- Track reading practice
- Listening allows kids to practice reading out loud 
- Earn badges and rewards by achieving milestones
- Choose one of our 8 fun avatars
- Personalized book recommendations



Books from a wide variety of categories are available:
-Adventure
-Animals
-Arts and Crafts
-Community

title: Left vs Right: Brain Games for Brain Training
description:
Our games are designed to test your Awareness, Adaptability, Reflex, Reasoning, Precision, and Patience.

Left vs Right includes 51 total games that test and train your brain in one or more of the 6 categories.

Left vs Right has Colorblind Mode! Just activate it in the app's settings menu.

VIP:
VIP members can train all 6 training categories each day. All games from those categories are available. You can additionally play and train individual games an unlimited amount of times each day. Only VIP members can also see Category Brain Quotients, Category Percentiles, and your score history for each game.

Regular:
Regular members can start out training 3 out of 6 categories each day for free. Only regular games from those categories will available. Additionally, you can complete the final 3 daily training games (including VIP games) for free after watching a short video. You can also play individual games using tokens. Regular games cost 1 token. VIP games cost 3 tokens. Additional tokens can only be earned by watching a short video.

Become a VIP member by upgrading your account with one of 4 types of subscriptions:

--7 Day Free Trial* / Weekly Subscription
-- Monthly VIP Subscription
-- Yearly VIP Subscription
-- Lifetime VIP Pass

Prices will vary depending on your country and local currency.

(* PLEASE NOTE: The free trial is a weekly subscription that offers you the first week for free. You must cancel the weekly subscription before the second week if you choose to not renew the weekly subscription.)

Thank you so much for playing!

Now go exercise your brain!

http://www.lvrbrain.com
http://www.twitter.com/lvrbrain
http://www.facebook.com/lvrbrain
descriptionHTML:
Our games are designed to test your Awareness, Adaptability, Reflex, Reasoning, Precision, and Patience.

Left vs Right includes 51 total games that test and train your brain in one or more of the 6 categories.

Left vs Right has Colorblind Mode! Just activate it in the app's settings menu.

VIP:
VIP members can train all 6 training categories each day. All games from those categories are available. You can additionally play and train individual games an unlimited amount of times each day. Only VIP members can also see Category Brain Quotients, Category Percentiles, and your score history for each game.

Regular:
Regular members can start out training 3 out of 6 categories each day for free. Only regular games from those categories will available. Additionally, you can complete the final 3 daily training games (including VIP games) for free after watching a short video. You can also play individual games using tokens. Regular games cost 1 token. VIP games cost 3 tokens. Additional tokens can only be earned by watching a short video.

Become a VIP member by upgrading your account with one of 4 types of subscriptions:

--7 Day Free Trial* / Weekly Subscription
-- Monthly VIP Subscription
-- Yearly VIP Subscription
-- Lifetime VIP Pass

Prices will vary depending on your country and local currency.

(* PLEASE NOTE: The free trial is a weekly subscription that offers you the first week for free. You must cancel the weekly subscription before the second week if you choose to not renew the weekly subscription.)

Thank you so much for playing!

Now go exercise your brain!

http://www.lvrbrain.com
http://www.twitter.com/lvrbrain
http://www.facebook.com/lvrbrain
summary: Exercise your grey matter every day with Left vs Right!
developerAddress:
4470 W Sunset Blvd Ste 107-1173
Los Angeles, CA 90027
recentChanges: Bug fixes
comments: I've tried a lot of brain training games and Left vs Right offers a generous amount of free content without over burdening you with ads. I shall probably invest in the VIP features as these seem good value and it's always encouraging to track your progress over time. As a musician I know that practise makes perfect. üòè

This game is great! I use it mostly every day. And I have notice how much it has helped me already! Its fun but yet educational and you don't even realize how much knowledge you obtain from the short everyday challenges. It has helped me in many ways already! Highly recommend to use daily or at least 3-4 times a week upon downloading. Enjoy!!

It's good but some of the games I can't play. If your colour blind like me and you have to discover what violet looks like. The only way i can do it is to eliminate the ones i can see first and hopefully they will be the last ones. I turned on colour blind mode but I don't know if it worked. It wasnt black and white. Some of the colours were invisible to me.

ùóüùó¢ùó©ùóò ùóúùóß! First time I've ùôöùô´ùôöùôß done a review immediately when asked. I went ahead and got the VIP one time payment and it is already worth the small price. I have been telling people (for years) that playing brain games can help stave off (their own or a loved one's) Alzheimer's and dementia. Now that I'm pushing 50 I'm taking my own advice-this app is perfect for it! Not only are the games fun, you can work targeted areas, track your progress, and see what percentile you are in.ü§ò

Don't use this app, please. I always try to keep an eye on permissions and this app is very psrsuasive with a message about giving them permission to access your storage. If you go to the app details, permissions area says that is for videos or whatever. If you agree with it, they can manipulate the information from your storage. I didn't play it because of this reason.

title: Recognize Dyslexia Disease
description:
Let us understand the disease of Dyslexia 
Dyslexia is a specific reading disability due to a defect in the brain's processing of graphic symbols. This app have lot of information of symptoms, Mechanisms, Prevention, Treatment & etc.

Note: All information about the application is for educational purposes only. For specific advice, diagnoses, and medical care, consult your doctor.

Please do not forget to rate us. If you have any suggestions or opinions to improve this application, please send us a message.

title: Dyslektz
description:
Dyslektz Reader is a special ebook reader application designed and developed for the book enthusiasts with dyslexia. With dyslexic-friendly user interface and built-in dyslexic font that converts books with any fonts and styles to OpenDyslexic font, it provides a hassle free reading experience to its users. It supports ebooks of both ePUB and PDF formats with the features specifically designed for accessibility.

Dyslektz Reader uses OpenDyslexic font by Abelardo Gonzalez, available at http://dyslexicfonts.com.
descriptionHTML:
Dyslektz Reader is a special ebook reader application designed and developed for the book enthusiasts with dyslexia. With dyslexic-friendly user interface and built-in dyslexic font that converts books with any fonts and styles to OpenDyslexic font, it provides a hassle free reading experience to its users. It supports ebooks of both ePUB and PDF formats with the features specifically designed for accessibility.

Dyslektz Reader uses OpenDyslexic font by Abelardo Gonzalez, available at http://dyslexicfonts.com.
summary: Dyslektz Reader is a ebook reader developed for book enthusiasts with dyslexia.
comments: This appears to require a lektz id but doesnt provide a way to regiater for an id. I would try it if I could find a way to register for an id but as is it seems useless unfortunately. I had high hopes for using this to read PDFs for classes and work. Guess I will have to keep searching.
Can not.add books...says tap Menu to add books and then the screen changes but no where to add books. Needs testing. Used to work!

This is a God send to me. Previously all ebooks were a struggle (and indeed all literature) as the words in most fonts dance on the page.  Now I can read my favourite books with ease. I also have this font on my kobo and have donated to the author!  Brilliant idea! Thankyou!

I couldn't get my daughters kindle books on thos app. I searched through all files. Even when I found the kindle folder nothing was showing. There is nothing on the app that helps you and after 45 mins of trying I gave up. If im doing something wrong please tell me.
Could be I do not under stand how to use,  it is hard to find my books and does not convert pdfs and other docs. Useless for my needs making go bye bye.

title: Spelling and Grammar
description:
English Spelling and Grammar will help you learn to spell well in an entertaining way by
playing multiple-choice tests and quizzes. It covers complete spelling and grammar
including spelling rules, tricky words, irregular spelling, and commonly misspelled
words.

You can practice your English in more than 100 categories:
* Short and long vowels/ syllables: Magic -e
* Consonants G or j? K, c, or ck? S or c? F, ff, or ph? D or t?
* Spelling patterns: Wa or wo? Thr or tr? Aw, au, al, all, or au? Oi or oy? W
or wh? X, cs, ct, or cc?
* Double consonants and letters
* R-controlled patterns: "Bossy r" words with er, ir, ur, or, etc.
* Endings, prefixes and suffixes:
-dge, -tch, -ge, -ch
-ey, -ie, -y, -ee
- ible or able
- ant or ent
- ance or ence
- ency or incy
- ary,ery, or ory
- tion, sion, cion, xion, or cian
- ic or ical
- for/fore/four
* Silent letters
* Homophones
* Grammar: Who or whom? Contractions and plurals. Verbs in present tense, past tense
and future tense.
*Capitalization (Uppercases and lowercases): names, professions, titles, cities,
geographical names, languages, countries, states, streets, holidays, stars, planets,
historical events, etc.
* Comma rules / punctuation: Serial comma, coordinating conjunctions,
subordinating conjunctions, relative clauses, interrupters
 * Grammar: Parts of speech (noun, adjectives, adverbs, verbs, etc.),
types of nouns (concrete /abstract, common /proper, countable /uncountable), types
of pronouns (personal, subject, object, possessive and reflexive pronouns) 
* Sentence structure/Sentence types: Complete sentences, fragments, run-ons. Independent and dependent clauses. Adverb clauses. Noun (nominal) clauses.

This app is the perfect spelling game for children of all ages, high school and university students, and adults. Compete in spelling games and become a spelling champion. 

Have spelling and grammar rules simply explained, store your statistics and results.  Track your kids‚Äô progress by connecting to Eductify Parent Connect. You can also create a study
plan to plan your day-to-day learning. It is so easy to become a master in spelling!
Suitable for many exams and competitions, such as Spelling bee, IELTS, TOEFL, SAT,
LSAT, MCAT, GMAT, GATE, CAT, CET, GRE, FCE, and CCE.

Improve your English spelling skills in a fun and challenging way!

Other minor improvements and fixes.
comments: It's not a bad app on the whole but as someone else said there's mistakes with the answers, For example in one question it said the twins, Peter and John live in a house and then asked how many people live in the house?. So of course I said 2 thinking Peter and John were the names of the twins but then in the answer it said 4 people lived here saying the twins AND Peter and John. I think someone needs to go back and double check the answers as it could be very confusing for children.
I just started,however it's great, to say at the very least. It's exactly as the creators described it. Thank you much =-)

It is very good for young keen children who are very willing to learn .The only reason I won't rate it a 5 star is because most of the challenging questions cost money ,and that makes more of a 4 star than a 5 star because of that minor problem
Love this very much. I think I will love it the more if correct words in the spelling section are defined.
I've looked for games exactly like this for years with little luck. I love it. Thanks

title: Continuous Attention Test
description:
This test assesses inattentiveness, impulsivity, sustained attention, and vigilance, and provides information that can be useful to diagnose impairments related to attention.

The test, inspired in the second version of the Conners Continuous Performance Test, requires users to press on the screen as fast as possible when a letter appears, unless the letter is ‚ÄúX‚Äù. Letters appear at different time intervals (1, 2, and 3 s) for 15 minutes. After the assessment, the test provides different continuous attention-derived measures, such as omissions, commissions, and reaction time along the evaluation.

summary: Attention assessment test
recentChanges: Update for new Android version
comments: This isn't a complete app for average people, I don't think more than 80% of people who have downloaded this would understand this app. 1. The instructions are only partial and doesn't indicate that the text will be of 15 minutes, You would have to read "About app" for that. 2. What the hell those figures even mean? No matter if the figures are accurate or not they do not even remark about ones performance in the test which feels like you have wasted all your time. Can be made a lot better.
Tap the screen except when you see the letter "?"... The next button covers the letter im supposed to be looking for so I cant read the full instructions. Very frustrating.
Silly app, it's meant to be testing you on your ability to react to a letter but the actual letter is hidden under UI so you don't know what it is. Basic error really.

Good Start! Nice Test with option to control sound and vibration Can you please add the following: 1. Option for test duration say 5 min, 10 min, 15 min, etc 2. Option for speed or interval between two letters 3. Can the reports be only in English. One worksheet can give explanation which will help the users to choose the right metric. Also user info not avbl in attachment is it because I clicked on Test. You may like to see the SART app on i-phone All the best

Interesting, but could be better if the app gave some indication of what the results meant. It's dissapointing to have done the test for what felt like no reason. It's hard to tell how your performance is in relation to other people's. The test could say things like if you're average, above average or below average. Or it could give some indication of the chances of you having ADHD (I myself am being tested tomorrow).

title: My ADHD
description:
After two years in the making, this new version of the app brings a completely new redesigned interface and a lot of performance improvements. 
This version has been restructured from the scratch and all its content has been revised and approved.

Additionally, this new version brings New Diagnostics Tests including the ASRS 1.1 for adults and SNAP-IV for kids, this are the most reliables tools used worldwide by psychiatrists on the diagnosis of ADHD.

- New Diagnostics
- Redesigned Interface
- Revised Content and Translations
- Added Translations for Youtube Videos
- Added Privacy Policy and Terms and Conditions
- Speed Improvements and Bug Fixes
descriptionHTML:
After two years in the making, this new version of the app brings a completely new redesigned interface and a lot of performance improvements.
This version has been restructured from the scratch and all its content has been revised and approved.

Additionally, this new version brings New Diagnostics Tests including the ASRS 1.1 for adults and SNAP-IV for kids, this are the most reliables tools used worldwide by psychiatrists on the diagnosis of ADHD.

- New Diagnostics
- Redesigned Interface
- Revised Content and Translations
- Added Translations for Youtube Videos
- Added Privacy Policy and Terms and Conditions
- Speed Improvements and Bug Fixes
summary: The first ADHD app with cognitive analysis of AI through facial recognition!
developerAddress:
411 Glebe Point Rd
Glebe
Australia
recentChanges: - Bug fixes and performance improvements
comments: The best source of information and inspiration to deal with ADHD yourself or relatives. Thank you, Jessica.

I would first like to say, Thank you. While I agree this app needs some work, this is the first app I've seen that at least tries to deliver what people with ADHD need. I don't know if English is the first language for this developer, so some help there is warranted. But with some polish and links to other sites to shore up his statements and back up information, it's a great start.
Too many "do nots". How about "do..." ADHD is not a disease. If you believe it is not one then get rid of all the times you say it.

This app is lacking in many areas, when translated to English it has many 
grammatical errors, also, no links to app referrals, no introduction to 
anchoring and lack of explanation in so many areas. For instance there is a 
section called, "All sorts of pills", yet only three of them are mentioned. 
The tests are not true diagnostic tools and should be introduced that way. 
It feels like the creator was in a hurry and just wanted it done. Given 
time and information, this app could be a very good resource.

title: Dyslektz
description:
Dyslektz Reader is a special ebook reader application designed and developed for the book enthusiasts with dyslexia. With dyslexic-friendly user interface and built-in dyslexic font that converts books with any fonts and styles to OpenDyslexic font, it provides a hassle free reading experience to its users. It supports ebooks of both ePUB and PDF formats with the features specifically designed for accessibility.

Dyslektz Reader uses OpenDyslexic font by Abelardo Gonzalez, available at http://dyslexicfonts.com.
descriptionHTML:
Dyslektz Reader is a special ebook reader application designed and developed for the book enthusiasts with dyslexia. With dyslexic-friendly user interface and built-in dyslexic font that converts books with any fonts and styles to OpenDyslexic font, it provides a hassle free reading experience to its users. It supports ebooks of both ePUB and PDF formats with the features specifically designed for accessibility.

Dyslektz Reader uses OpenDyslexic font by Abelardo Gonzalez, available at http://dyslexicfonts.com.
summary: Dyslektz Reader is a ebook reader developed for book enthusiasts with dyslexia.
comments: This appears to require a lektz id but doesnt provide a way to regiater for an id. I would try it if I could find a way to register for an id but as is it seems useless unfortunately. I had high hopes for using this to read PDFs for classes and work. Guess I will have to keep searching.
Can not.add books...says tap Menu to add books and then the screen changes but no where to add books. Needs testing. Used to work!

This is a God send to me. Previously all ebooks were a struggle (and indeed all literature) as the words in most fonts dance on the page.  Now I can read my favourite books with ease. I also have this font on my kobo and have donated to the author!  Brilliant idea! Thankyou!

I couldn't get my daughters kindle books on thos app. I searched through all files. Even when I found the kindle folder nothing was showing. There is nothing on the app that helps you and after 45 mins of trying I gave up. If im doing something wrong please tell me.
Could be I do not under stand how to use,  it is hard to find my books and does not convert pdfs and other docs. Useless for my needs making go bye bye.
