title: Spelling and Grammar
description:
English Spelling and Grammar will help you learn to spell well in an entertaining way by
playing multiple-choice tests and quizzes. It covers complete spelling and grammar
including spelling rules, tricky words, irregular spelling, and commonly misspelled
words.

You can practice your English in more than 100 categories:
* Short and long vowels/ syllables: Magic -e
* Consonants G or j? K, c, or ck? S or c? F, ff, or ph? D or t?
* Spelling patterns: Wa or wo? Thr or tr? Aw, au, al, all, or au? Oi or oy? W
or wh? X, cs, ct, or cc?
* Double consonants and letters
* R-controlled patterns: "Bossy r" words with er, ir, ur, or, etc.
* Endings, prefixes and suffixes:
-dge, -tch, -ge, -ch
-ey, -ie, -y, -ee
- ible or able
- ant or ent
- ance or ence
- ency or incy
- ary,ery, or ory
- tion, sion, cion, xion, or cian
- ic or ical
- for/fore/four
* Silent letters
* Homophones
* Grammar: Who or whom? Contractions and plurals. Verbs in present tense, past tense
and future tense.
*Capitalization (Uppercases and lowercases): names, professions, titles, cities,
geographical names, languages, countries, states, streets, holidays, stars, planets,
historical events, etc.
* Comma rules / punctuation: Serial comma, coordinating conjunctions,
subordinating conjunctions, relative clauses, interrupters
 * Grammar: Parts of speech (noun, adjectives, adverbs, verbs, etc.),
types of nouns (concrete /abstract, common /proper, countable /uncountable), types
of pronouns (personal, subject, object, possessive and reflexive pronouns) 
* Sentence structure/Sentence types: Complete sentences, fragments, run-ons. Independent and dependent clauses. Adverb clauses. Noun (nominal) clauses.

This app is the perfect spelling game for children of all ages, high school and university students, and adults. Compete in spelling games and become a spelling champion. 

Have spelling and grammar rules simply explained, store your statistics and results.  Track your kids‚Äô progress by connecting to Eductify Parent Connect. You can also create a study
plan to plan your day-to-day learning. It is so easy to become a master in spelling!
Suitable for many exams and competitions, such as Spelling bee, IELTS, TOEFL, SAT,
LSAT, MCAT, GMAT, GATE, CAT, CET, GRE, FCE, and CCE.

Improve your English spelling skills in a fun and challenging way!

comments: It's not a bad app on the whole but as someone else said there's mistakes with the answers, For example in one question it said the twins, Peter and John live in a house and then asked how many people live in the house?. So of course I said 2 thinking Peter and John were the names of the twins but then in the answer it said 4 people lived here saying the twins AND Peter and John. I think someone needs to go back and double check the answers as it could be very confusing for children.
I just started,however it's great, to say at the very least. It's exactly as the creators described it. Thank you much =-)

It is very good for young keen children who are very willing to learn .The only reason I won't rate it a 5 star is because most of the challenging questions cost money ,and that makes more of a 4 star than a 5 star because of that minor problem
Love this very much. I think I will love it the more if correct words in the spelling section are defined.
I've looked for games exactly like this for years with little luck. I love it. Thanks

title: Continuous Attention Test
description:
This test assesses inattentiveness, impulsivity, sustained attention, and vigilance, and provides information that can be useful to diagnose impairments related to attention.

The test, inspired in the second version of the Conners Continuous Performance Test, requires users to press on the screen as fast as possible when a letter appears, unless the letter is ‚ÄúX‚Äù. Letters appear at different time intervals (1, 2, and 3 s) for 15 minutes. After the assessment, the test provides different continuous attention-derived measures, such as omissions, commissions, and reaction time along the evaluation.
descriptionHTML:
This test assesses inattentiveness, impulsivity, sustained attention, and vigilance, and provides information that can be useful to diagnose impairments related to attention.

The test, inspired in the second version of the Conners Continuous Performance Test, requires users to press on the screen as fast as possible when a letter appears, unless the letter is ‚ÄúX‚Äù. Letters appear at different time intervals (1, 2, and 3 s) for 15 minutes. After the assessment, the test provides different continuous attention-derived measures, such as omissions, commissions, and reaction time along the evaluation.
summary: Attention assessment test
recentChanges: Update for new Android version
comments: This isn't a complete app for average people, I don't think more than 80% of people who have downloaded this would understand this app. 1. The instructions are only partial and doesn't indicate that the text will be of 15 minutes, You would have to read "About app" for that. 2. What the hell those figures even mean? No matter if the figures are accurate or not they do not even remark about ones performance in the test which feels like you have wasted all your time. Can be made a lot better.
Tap the screen except when you see the letter "?"... The next button covers the letter im supposed to be looking for so I cant read the full instructions. Very frustrating.
Silly app, it's meant to be testing you on your ability to react to a letter but the actual letter is hidden under UI so you don't know what it is. Basic error really.

Good Start! Nice Test with option to control sound and vibration Can you please add the following: 1. Option for test duration say 5 min, 10 min, 15 min, etc 2. Option for speed or interval between two letters 3. Can the reports be only in English. One worksheet can give explanation which will help the users to choose the right metric. Also user info not avbl in attachment is it because I clicked on Test. You may like to see the SART app on i-phone All the best

Interesting, but could be better if the app gave some indication of what the results meant. It's dissapointing to have done the test for what felt like no reason. It's hard to tell how your performance is in relation to other people's. The test could say things like if you're average, above average or below average. Or it could give some indication of the chances of you having ADHD (I myself am being tested tomorrow).

title: A Familiar Fairytale Dyslexic Text Based Adventure
description:
This game was created to help other feel the frustration of having dyslexia.
You play as a small fox a fairy tale story with Kings, Queens and witches.
We don't claim to be actually like what a dyslexic person sees, but a simulation of the frustration.

There are a bunch of options to try to make the game easier to play based on people's common conceptions on what fixes dyslexia.
There is an option to add a colored overlay and remove the flicker in an attempt to combat "Scotopic Sensitivity Syndrome/ Irlen Syndrome".
And there is an option to change the font to Open Dyslexic which in my opinion is harder to read.
There are options which allow you to play the game in non-dyslexic mode if you want, but wheres the fun in that.

The game includes a range of accessibility settings.
Color Overlays
Page Flicker Off
Open Dyslexia Font
Text To Speech

Review by John Walker:
https://buried-treasure.org/2019/11/19/a-familiar-fairytale/?fbclid=IwAR0yg4mFoclDV89ZTHamhMm2kV1MoiFitAAgzyNXuV-2qR2DjNyw1FVl5_U

title: My ADHD
description:
After two years in the making, this new version of the app brings a completely new redesigned interface and a lot of performance improvements. 
This version has been restructured from the scratch and all its content has been revised and approved.

Additionally, this new version brings New Diagnostics Tests including the ASRS 1.1 for adults and SNAP-IV for kids, this are the most reliables tools used worldwide by psychiatrists on the diagnosis of ADHD.

- New Diagnostics
- Redesigned Interface
- Revised Content and Translations
- Added Translations for Youtube Videos
- Added Privacy Policy and Terms and Conditions
- Speed Improvements and Bug Fixes

411 Glebe Point Rd
Glebe

comments: The best source of information and inspiration to deal with ADHD yourself or relatives. Thank you, Jessica.

I would first like to say, Thank you. While I agree this app needs some work, this is the first app I've seen that at least tries to deliver what people with ADHD need. I don't know if English is the first language for this developer, so some help there is warranted. But with some polish and links to other sites to shore up his statements and back up information, it's a great start.
Too many "do nots". How about "do..." ADHD is not a disease. If you believe it is not one then get rid of all the times you say it.

This app is lacking in many areas, when translated to English it has many 
grammatical errors, also, no links to app referrals, no introduction to 
anchoring and lack of explanation in so many areas. For instance there is a 
section called, "All sorts of pills", yet only three of them are mentioned. 
The tests are not true diagnostic tools and should be introduced that way. 
It feels like the creator was in a hurry and just wanted it done. Given 
time and information, this app could be a very good resource.

title: Dolphin EasyReader
description:
EasyReader is a FREE accessible reading app for readers with dyslexia, low vision or blindness. Browse & download from the World's largest collection of talking book and newspaper libraries. Open & read books from your device, email or the cloud. Or copy text from anywhere on your phone & hear EasyReader read it back to you. Experience perfectly synchronized text & audio. Or for text only titles, EasyReader can add a human sounding voice of your choice. Boost comfort or contrast - choose colours, text size and highlights to suit your visual needs.

Make your books' text as big as your eyes require. Unlike other mainstream reading apps, there's no restriction with EasyReader. Zoom in with a standard 2 finger pinch or make fine adjustments with the simple sliders. There's never any blurry text or fuzzy fonts - your books' words are always crystal clear and always easy on the eye.

Navigate your books or newspapers by skipping directly to specific pages or headings. Search your book for words or phrases. Add text bookmarks or record your own audio bookmarks and return to them with ease.

EasyReader is fully optimized for use with Talkback and BrailleBack.

EasyReader is available in the following languages: Swedish, English, French, Italian, Dutch, Norwegian, Polish, Russian, Turkish and German.

---------------------------------------------------------------

EasyReader connects directly to World's largest collection of accessible book libraries with 100,000s of titles:
- Anderslezen (Belgium)
- ATZ newspapers (German)
- AVH √âole (France)
- Bookshare¬Æ (US)
- Bookshare Ireland (Ireland)
- CBB (Netherlands)
- CELA (Canada)
- dzb lesen (Germany)
- DZDN (Poland)
- ePubBooks (All languages, no login required)
- Inl√§sningstj√§nst AB (Sweden)
- KDD (Czech Republic)
- Legimus (Sweden)
- Libro Parlato (Italy)
- LKF (Russia)
- NBH Hamburg (Germany)

- Project Gutenberg (All languages, no login required)
- RNIB Reading Services (UK)
- RNIB Overdrive (UK)

- Vereniging Onbeperkt Lezen (Netherlands)

Or access newspaper services from:
- Bookshare¬Æ Periodicals (US)

- NFB-NEWSLINE¬Æ (US)
- NKL (Finland)
- Passend Lezen (Netherlands)

** Important Information**
A login is required for the majority of the accessible book libraries that EasyReader connects to. Please contact the libraries directly to arrange your login. Books that are protected by DRM (including those purchased via Kindle) are not compatible with EasyReader.

comments: I've successfully installed EasyReader on my wife's Tesco Hudl 2 android device but it is stuck on the "Loading" screen. Is there a fix for this? Thank you. UPDATE 29:10:2020 ..... Have just loaded your latest update. Lo and behold the app opened and asked me to log in. I closed the app to tell my wife that the problem seemed to have been fixed, and when I tried to open it for her it was AGAIN stuck on the "Loading" screen. Please advise.

A truley appalling app. UPDATE 31/10 back to freezing and DELETING DOWNLOADED BOOKS.PLEASE FIX THIS APP AS IT'S DRIVING RNIB USERS CRAZY VERY DISTRESSING. Have been forced to install this for my wife,as R.N.I.B. have decided to switch from Overdrive.Firstly,it's not available for Fire So,buy a new Huawei tablet,only to find that it keeps freezing,sleep timer doesn't work,bookmark doesn't work and you need to reboot it EVERY time you use it for more than 20 minutes

When it works usually its amazing! but for some reason today im logged out and every option i try it won't let me log back in?! Any advice would be much appreciated! I miss my books! Updat: logged in this am back to normal! Yippee. I absolutely love this apo. Being blind its an absolute lifeline to help me through the long days. Thsnk you!

OK but with a few glitches that I'm hoping that future updates will solve. May I suggest that the rewind and fast forward buttons are moved further away from the pause button. With limited vision it is far too easy to hit the wrong button when trying to pause. Thank you.

This App keeps crashing.. so sad I have used it for many years and it will play then stop and crash. Or if I change screens to will go all white and stop working. It also is not starting when I left off so I have to fast forward to the spot it stopped at.

comments: This app in my opinion, is terrible. The keyboard is slow and makes you have mistakes. And the fact that you have to get premium to get better grammar fixtures is just terrible. I don't recommend you use this app, on mobile.

I purchased the premium app and the download refused to work. I have tried many times, but it is defective. The response team at Grammarly is terrible. You can only reach an automated system and it asks for the same information again and again. They have terrible customer relations. I will never use them again, .I wasted my $140 and they refuse to acknowledge my purchase even with a receipt from paypal.

The grammar checking is pretty good and the keyboard is decent, but both are too slow. I'm also not sure that grammar checking fits well inside a keyboard. It should be a separate app, sort of like Proofreader. That way I can use whatever keyboard I want and whatever grammar checker I want without having to find one app that's amazing at both. Do one thing and do it well.

I just downloaded it and it was working well for a good amount of time but after some hours, when I was checking grammar with it, I was having lots of problems. Like for example, I forgot to put comma after a word which was necessary but when it corrected the sentence, a letter missed out. Same happened next time. It's really frustrating, fix this problem please. Otherwise it's a good app

This app is not ready for prime time. I thought it was a great idea, but the keyboard puts more errors than it removes. To put a space between letters you need a hammer for the keyboard. My standard Samsung keyboard is much better in that aspect. And many of the simple mistakes that I make the app never corrected them. If they fix these problem, it might be worth the effort. But given that it takes away a row of keys (the dedicated numeric keys), no so good.

title: DYS2GO - learning game for dyslexic young adults
description:
The project Learning games for Dyslexic young adults is co funded by the Erasmus+ Programme of the European Union.

The aim of the project is the provision of a range of mobile highly motivating and stimulating learning games for a carefully selected range of skills known to be important for young dyslexic adults.

A dyslexic person needs to train his or her perception skills on a regular base, otherwise all inclusive education measures, for example, in VET, higher education or adult continuing training, may fail. Such training is a prerequisite for phonological and orthographic processing. Inclusive learning requires accessibility of individual learning resources (for example, digital learning tools tailored to general or specific learning needs) to learn in a variety of ways that compensates deficiencies. Interactive exercises can help dyslexic persons to train specific skills. Such exercises are available, but the majority of them are focused on children and do not usually address specific problems. Not surprisingly, young dyslexic adults do not like these exercises due to their childish nature or because they are seen as irrelevant. Therefore, there is a need for training tools that consider and address the preferences of young dyslexic adults from the age of 16 onwards. And usually such training has to take place in the afternoon or evening (outside of formal education institutions) and has to be provided by teachers/trainers specialised on dyslexia.

title: Dislexis
description:
Dislexis.
Aplicaci√≥n que surge como una alternativa para los especialistas en el tratamiento de la dislexia para personas de todas las edades.
Existen dos maneras de registrarse como tutor (terapeuta) y como usuario para posteriormente iniciar sesi√≥n.
Principalmente se cuenta con dos m√≥dulos:
Examen diagnostico donde se har√°n preguntas frecuentes que seg√∫n los especialistas ayudan a determinar con una buena precisi√≥n el padecimiento de esta condici√≥n.
Modo test. Ser√° un juego interactivo donde el paciente pondr√° a prueba sus habilidades mientras se divierte. Para ello se le mostrar√° una imagen y tendr√° que arrastrar la palabra correcta que representa la imagen.

Principalmente se cuenta con dos m√≥dulos:
Examen diagnostico donde se har√°n preguntas frecuentes que seg√∫n los especialistas ayudan a determinar con una buena precisi√≥n el padecimiento de esta condici√≥n.
Modo test. Ser√° un juego interactivo donde el paciente pondr√° a prueba sus habilidades mientras se divierte. Para ello se le mostrar√° una imagen y tendr√° que arrastrar la palabra correcta que representa la imagen.

title: Correct Spelling: Voice based Spelling checker
description:
Correct Spelling is the voice based spelling checker app that saves your effort to find the right spellings. Just speak the English words and find the grammatical corrected sentences with improved spelling mistakes. Speak the English word or sentences in the mic and see is it a correct spelling on your screen. Correct spelling app is makes English spelling writing easy. Find the difficult words, phrases and sentences. Now English Dictionary is not required.  

How to use correct spelling app
Open the app, speak any word and copy or share

Correct Spelling features
- Voice base input
- Any word or sentences
- Paragraph support

title: Read Aloud
description:
Designed to make it as simple as possible for people with dyslexia, and visual impairment to turn printed text to spoken words in one click. The app opens in camera mode, a verbal prompt asks the user to line up camera with the text they want to be read and to click white camera button on screen.
Once this is done the app starts reading aloud the text. Recommended camera spec 4MP or better.

Once this is done the app starts reading aloud the text. Recommended camera spec 4MP or better.

title: NaturalReader Text to Speech
description:
NaturalReader is text to speech app that reads text, PDF, webpages, and eBooks aloud to you with our quality, natural-sounding voices.

NaturalReader is an essential tool for those with dyslexia and other reading difficulties. Open up your ears to a new reading experience with over 50 voices in over 20 languages. Just sit back, relax, and let us read to you.

Are you a student bogged down by a long reading list? Use NaturalReader to upload your e-textbooks, eBooks, or class notes to ease the burden and rest your eyes. Listen and review on the go while commuting to class or multitasking at home. Bookmark important pages for easy access later on. For both students and writers alike, NaturalReader is also an efficient proofreading tool.

NaturalReader is a great app for all kinds of readers. Adjust the speaker's speed and background color to suit your own preferences. Use it to multitask and enjoy listening on the go while running, commuting, or any household tasks.

Open up any email attachments with NaturalReader to get your important documents to read to you instantly. You can also connect to your Dropbox, OneDrive, or Google Drive account to easily access and listen to your files from your device. Keep up with your favorite webpages with our built-in browser.

To improve your reading experience, we have added a new Pronunciation Editor. Use this feature to fine-tune the pronunciation of new or unusual words, or to improve the readability of acronyms.

No matter what kind of reader you are, experience more with NaturalReader.

Note: DRM-protected eBooks from iBooks, Kindle, Nook, or Adobe OverDrive cannot be opened with NaturalReader

comments: Good apps with lots of "premium voice" and great looking ui. But the cons is: 1. They don't support web reading unlike @Voice. 2. If you using pdf better use moon reader, they have simplified mode and night mode also they bookmark your pdf or book folder (no sign up) and of course they can use text to speech as well. 3. They don't have search feature or favourite for the voice so good luck searching it. The pros probably 1. They can use cloud, 2. They can use ocr (paid). 3. Lots of voice (paid)

Love the app. It's really good for slow readers like me. Can you guys please add folders for adding custom books you own so you can read them? I also love the CC feature as well. I have bad reading comprehension and a intellectual learning disability so I have a hard time learning. It's really hard trying to find a app like this. It's a good app if anyone has a learning disability who struggles. If I take a picture of a Japanese light novel book in English that I bought will ORC pick it up?

I bought NR several years ago. Its been the best program i found up until last year. It got very glitchy. Today i had a problem with it playing my document at all even after i restarted the app. I uninstalled and reinstalled only to find out the entire app was updated and now is a monthly subscription. Im not where i can afford that atm and Im a sad that I didnt realise it before i uninstalled. I prefer one time pymnts. The new version says there is a free version but it wont work on my phone.
This app has potential however it cannot read hyphenated words such as self-employed instead it reads "self minus employed." As I have lots of readings with hyphenated words this becomes problematic.
100 percent functional. Love it. Will be 6sing forever.

title: Snap Reader
description:
Instant reading assistance:
- Scan any document with your device's camera (OCR)
- Read aloud mode (Text-to-speech/TTS)
- Reformat text for readability
- Rich font settings
- Tap any word to learn more (pronunciation, dictionary lookup, translate, etc.)
- Save a document for later

Great reading & learning tool for: reading comprehension & fluency, dyslexia (dyslexic readers), auditory learning styles (auditory learners), and more!

comments: It works! The only issues I have is that it reads the dash (-) as 'minus' when its connecting words. The dash should say not anything when its used to join words. It also separates the page so it reads parts separately that aren't meant to be separate. Besides that it's great for auditory listeners with school and learning. Just reading in general its helpful for processing what its saying.

So far so good. You have to take pictures correctly or the alignment might mess up the reading, but when you do, it is very useful. Love it so far and would definitely recommend. I'm just upset I didn't have an app like this earlier in my college career. Lol
it's perfectly awesome - no hastle, works well except for your lack of try catch errors thrown crashes pretty hard on failures, e.g. no text captured
Terrible Dont buy this app if you do you cant hear anything because it is mumbled and he voice is awkward AND you can't focus on the text

title: Brilliant Spelling Tutor (LITE)
description:
Anyone can become a Brilliant Speller and increase their vocabulary!

The LITE version lets you evaluate Brilliant Spelling with just a few levels and the ability to edit one custom word list.  We hope this gives you a great way to check it out!

Brilliant Spelling is a fun and entertaining game with a friendly speaking robot to guide you.  Advance through the levels as you increase your knowledge.  Over 3100 American English words are included in the full version (about 500 words in this LITE version).  You may also enter your own word lists and play the game to learn them.  Great for adults and kids who want to learn to spell but wish to have fun doing it!  

Brilliant Spelling provides an immersive environment. The virtual tutor interacts with you on a first name basis giving you encouragement. Not only will you improve your spelling and vocabulary skills, you will feel better about yourself!

Special features include:
- Virtual artificial intelligence tutor with speaking voice.
- Word levels for 1st grade through adult.
- Enter your own word lists in My Levels. (One level in this LITE version.)
- Export word lists to text file and import word lists. (Full version only).
- Uses knowledge of brain function and learning processes.
- Great for ensuring you will ace a spelling quiz or impress your boss.
- Magical for ADD/ADHD/Dyslexia students.  It engages the logical parts of the brain that most games can't.
- Keeps track of multiple users so you can let others play without losing your own scores.

Brilliant Spelling works like this:  Start by entering your name. From then on, the tutor refers to you by name.  The Brilliant Spelling tutor uses text-to-speech to talk to the user.  What happens next is almost magical.  The robotic tutor named WordBot makes friends with you as it steps through the spelling levels.  It is a two way interaction with you entering words and tapping the buttons, and the tutor talking and drawing you in.  You have to try it to believe it.

Brilliant Spelling uses the default Android voice.

This Lite version is free to try before you decide to purchase the full version.

title: Echo Word
description:
Echo Word is an app to help people of all ages with words. This app is not a spell checker, but instead, uses your own voice and a speak back function to display the word you may be after, also can read words that you copy into the text box. 

Try typing a word you can't read off a letter or poster, then have your device read it back to you!

Why not try copying and pasting an entire E-mail into Echo Word and have it read back to you for ease!

Echo Word was made by someone with dyslexia to help with day to day life, and would like to help all dyslexic and non dyslexic alike, in a world with words.
descriptionHTML:
Echo Word is an app to help people of all ages with words. This app is not a spell checker, but instead, uses your own voice and a speak back function to display the word you may be after, also can read words that you copy into the text box.

Try typing a word you can't read off a letter or poster, then have your device read it back to you!

Why not try copying and pasting an entire E-mail into Echo Word and have it read back to you for ease!

Echo Word was made by someone with dyslexia to help with day to day life, and would like to help all dyslexic and non dyslexic alike, in a world with words.
summary: Echo Word, to help people who get lost in a world with words.
comments: I use this every day at work. It is a life save for those who are not the most confident spellers. Me
it's really good app! very helpful

title: ReadMe!
description:
ReadMe! is a unique tool for reading. It helps both experienced & struggling reader alike!

---

You can unlock ALL FEATURES  by signing up for an optional subscription, either monthly or yearly. 

---

ReadMe! offers reading technologies like

### BeeLine Reader, which has won awards from Stanford University and Dell Education for its ability to increase reading speed and ease. BeeLine Reader dramatically improves reading fluency for readers of all levels‚Äîfrom dyslexic to prolific.

BeeLine Reader is available for free trial and as a part of the ReadMe! subscription.
For more information about BeeLine Reader, check out writeups in Fast Company Design (http://bit.ly/1737EK5) and The Verge (http://bit.ly/GGCfrr).

### We also offer Spritz, an exciting new and popular tool for reading at lightning speed. Spritz makes speed reading available to anyone! It shows one word at a time with the Optical Recognition Point (ORP) highlighted in red so your eye don't have to move at all, making it possible to read at super speeds without any training (Think Neo in Matrix). About 80% of the time spent reading is used just moving your eyes finding the ORP.

Spritz requires an internet connection. Offline reading with Spritz is available for ReadMe! Premium accounts.
For more information about Spritz, check out http://www.spritzinc.com

### Our app offers multi-device syncing so that you can always pick up where you left off. If you‚Äôre looking for an app that will make your reading time more enjoyable and more efficient‚Äîlook no further!

### Possible to Spritz both ePub and PDF!

### Cross device synchronization is available via subscription IAP. Details for the optional Synchronisation service subscription:

### ALL PREMIUM FEATURES available via subscription IAP.

Details for the optional Premium subscription:

- Monthly or yearly auto-renewable subscription
- $2.99 / month, $29.99 / year
- Payment will be charged to GooglePlay Account at confirmation of purchase
- Subscription automatically renews unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period
- Account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period, and identify the cost of the renewal
- Subscriptions may be managed by the user and auto-renewal may be turned off by going to the user's Account Settings after purchase
- No cancellation of the current subscription is allowed during active subscription period
- Privacy policy: https://www.readmei.com/privacy_policy.txt
- Terms & Conditions: https://www.readmei.com/terms.html
- Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription to that publication.
- For support questions, please contact support@readmei.com

=========

For more information about ReadMe, see our writeup in Reuters (http://www.reuters.com/article/2014/06/23/apps-reading-idUSL2N0P11J320140623) or check us out at https://www.readmei.com

title: Khan Academy Kids: Free educational games & books
description:
Learning is joyful with Khan Academy Kids! Our award-winning app includes thousands of educational activities, books, songs, and games for toddlers, preschoolers, kindergarteners, and first graders. A cast of adorable characters guide children through lessons, and our adaptive learning path customizes their experience to help them master different skills. 
 
Children can learn reading, language, writing, math, social-emotional development, and more. Open-ended activities and games like drawing and coloring encourage creativity and self-expression. 
 
Khan Academy Kids is completely free, forever - no ads and no subscriptions necessary. And we‚Äôre always adding new content to keep kids engaged, including books and songs from Super Simple Songs¬Æ, Bellwether Media, and National Geographic Young Explorer Magazine.
 
Download today and let the joyful learning begin!
 
NEW TOOLS FOR TEACHERS that can support remote learning
- Set up your class easily
- Search lessons by standards
- Assign lessons
- View reports to monitor student progress
 
NEW FIRST GRADE LESSONS
‚Ä¢ We‚Äôve added thousands of new interactive activities, exercises, and books that cover English Language Arts (ELA) and math Common Core standards. 
 
HIGH-QUALITY, AWARD-WINNING CONTENT 
‚Ä¢ Common Sense Media‚Äî5 stars Educational Value, 5 stars Ease of Play
‚Ä¢ Children's Technology Review Editor's Choice Award for Excellence in Design‚Äî100% Rating
‚Ä¢ Parents' Choice Foundation Gold Award
‚Ä¢ American Association of School Librarians‚Äî2019 Best App for Teaching and Learning 
 
ROBUST CURRICULUM
‚Ä¢ Reading and literacy‚Äîphonics,letters, spelling, and writing
‚Ä¢ Language‚Äîvocabulary, parts of speech
‚Ä¢ Math‚Äîcounting, numbers, addition, subtraction, shapes, and measuring
‚Ä¢ Executive function and logic‚Äîfocus, memory, and problem-solving
 
PERSONALIZED LEARNING EXPERIENCE
‚Ä¢ Adaptive learning path allows each child to learn at their own pace.
‚Ä¢ Children learn independently in the Library‚Äîa collection of activities, books, and videos.
‚Ä¢ Kids can read books on their own or follow along with recorded audio narration.
 
JOYFUL LEARNING
‚Ä¢ Five whimsical characters encourage children to think and learn.
‚Ä¢ Highly interactive educational games and activities.
 
EMOTIONAL & PHYSICAL DEVELOPMENT
‚Ä¢ Social-emotional‚Äîrelationships, self-control, and empathy
‚Ä¢ Motor and physical development‚Äîgross and fine motor skills, health, and nutrition
‚Ä¢ Creative expression‚Äîdrawing, storytelling, and coloring
 
CREATED BY EXPERTS
‚Ä¢ Developed in collaboration with experts at the Stanford Graduate School of Education
‚Ä¢ Aligns with Head Start Early Learning Outcomes Framework and Common Core Standards
 
We‚Äôd love to hear from you. Please visit us at khanacademykids.org, or drop us a line at khankids@khanacademy.org.
 
ABOUT KHAN ACADEMY
Khan Academy is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization with the mission of providing a free, world-class education for anyone, anywhere. Khan Academy Kids was created by experienced early learning experts who have created 22 other top-selling titles and received 22 Parents‚Äô Choice Awards, 19 Children‚Äôs Technology Review Awards, and a KAPi award for Best Children‚Äôs App at the International Consumer Electronics Show. The Khan Academy Kids team is a passionate group of engineers, artists, designers, and educators who joined Khan Academy from Duck Duck Moose, a maker of popular educational apps for kids. Khan Academy Kids is 100% free without ads or subscriptions.
 
ABOUT SUPER SIMPLE SONGS¬Æ 
Skyship Entertainment‚Ñ¢ is the creator of the beloved children‚Äôs brand, Super Simple‚Ñ¢. Their award-winning Super Simple Songs¬Æ combines delightful animation and puppetry with original and classic kids‚Äô songs to help make learning simple and fun. With over 10 billion views and 10 million subscribers on YouTube, their songs and videos are favorites with parents, teachers, and kids around the globe.

PRIVACY POLICY
www.khanacademy.org/kids/privacy-policy

recentChanges:
Happy Halloween from Kodi Bear and all her friends üéÉ Update Khan Academy Kids today for new Halloween content including:
üëª Spooky videos from Super Simple Songs!
üßô‚ÄçÔ∏è Enchanted math and reading activities!

comments: I absolutely love this app. It is beyond any other "so called" educational app. This is so intuitive and really engages my kids. I have a child with exceptionalities as well and she is able to navigate, understand and learn the concepts. I love how the content is tailored to the age of the child. My son is able to learn more advance subjects by changing the age. The best part is that there are ABSOLUTELY NO ADS and it is free!!! I highly recommend this to all parents.

I am absolutely in LOVE with this app! It has the best learning material and no ads. Perfect!! I was looking for something educational for my 7 and 4 year old, and this is the only one I will ever use for them. It's perfect. Seriously deleting all other learning apps and games because this is the only one they will ever need. I can't believe it's completely free and no ads. Thank you so much for making this amazing app free for my children and helping them learn. I am so greatful!!!

My little niece loves it! Everything is VERY clear, easy to understand, fun and really helps keep their attn while learning! NO ADS and NEVER boring!! Can't believe this is a FREE APP!!! KAK doesn't give kids the answers, they have to actually figure things out (and learn), which is wonderful! The fun (sometimes silly) songs and educational stories are great!! There's constant positive reinforcement, throughout. If they get an answer wrong, they're encouraged to keep trying. EXCELLENT APP üëå!!

We love this app! It's one of my son's favorite things to do on his new tablet. He calls it his "learning". I do wish you could track progress through the regular Khan Academy (as he has an account there), and there's definitely a need for more to do offline. We like to use this in the car or while we are out for very long periods of time, but he is getting bored with the small bits he can do offline. Otherwise, this is a really great app, overall.

Picky 4 and 6 year old enjoyed the challenges. Most of the time, I have to remind them to try the apps but not this one‚Äîthey voluntarily uses it. The user interface of the app of a thumbs up too. It's easier for parents to find a subject and see which topics from their list hasn't been opened yet because it shows a check sign once you're done with a certain topic.

title: Dislexia: Ejercicios pr√°cticos
description:
¬øDificultad para leer correctamente? Desde Leonardo Da Vinci hasta John F. Kennedy han padecido dislexia, debemos saber que esta condici√≥n arraigada tanto en genios como en gente com√∫n no impide llevar una vida normal; sobrellevar los obst√°culos del lenguaje solo necesita de una buena app y una motivaci√≥n. Nosotros te traemos lo primero‚Ä¶ gracias a esta fabulosa app podr√°s desarrollar una gran cantidad de ejercicios y actividades para ayudar (a ti o a tus hijos) . 
 
"The Dislexia App" est√° destinada a despejar todas aquellas dudas y mitos acerca de la dislexia, proporcionar datos precisos y comprensibles sobre ella y, sobre todo con una gran cantidad de actividades y ejercicios para ayudar a aquellos que presentan esta condici√≥n, y que abarcan los niveles fon√©tico, fonol√≥gico, morfol√≥gico y sint√°ctico del lenguaje.

CARACTER√çSTICAS
‚Ä¢ elaborada con un dise√±o pr√°ctico y colores amigables tanto para los ni√±os o j√≥venes disl√©xicos como para los padres, tutores y especialistas, ideal para la resoluci√≥n HD.
‚Ä¢ Men√∫ principal con botones y opciones totalmente intuitivas gracias a sus √≠conos y textos.
‚Ä¢ Opci√≥n de elegir el color de texto y su respectivo fondo para toda la aplicaci√≥n.
‚Ä¢ Se puede agrandar y disminuir el tama√±o de los textos informativos mediante el zoom. Solo junte o separe los dedos en la pantalla.

Dentro de la informaci√≥n recopilada para fines did√°cticos, la aplicaci√≥n contiene los siguientes temas:
‚Ä¢ Informaci√≥n concisa sobre la Historia de la dislexia y su consideraci√≥n en el tiempo.
‚Ä¢ Definici√≥n y Tipolog√≠a de la dislexia, adem√°s de las Rutas para acceder al significado de las palabras.
‚Ä¢ Causas de la dislexia explicadas bajo 5 enfoques: fonol√≥gico, sensorial, neurol√≥gico, genetista, conductual y psicomotor.
‚Ä¢ Diagn√≥stico y tratamiento: signos o s√≠ntomas m√°s comunes de la dislexia en orden cronol√≥gico y sugerencias sobre c√≥mo afrontarla.
‚Ä¢ Una relaci√≥n de los disl√©xicos m√°s famosos de la historia: Albert Einstein, Leonardo da Vinci, Tom Cruise, John F. Kennedy, Tommy Hilfiger y muchos m√°s.
‚Ä¢ Mitos y realidades acerca de esta "enfermedad" o "discapacidad", que actualmente ya no es considerada como tal.
‚Ä¢ Listado y geolocalizaci√≥n con mapas urbanos de los centros especializados en tratamiento y ense√±anza especializada en la dislexia y condiciones similares. M√°s de 30 centros recomendados en Am√©rica Latina y el resto del mundo (para disl√©xicos no hispanohablantes).

El √°rea de ejercicios, dividida en 5 grandes bloques que contienen entre 4 a 8 actividades cada uno, alberga innumerables ejercicios para que usted, su hijo, hija, alumno o alumna con dislexia puedan entrenar y repasar a diario, y compensar las dificultades en cuanto a la escritura y la asociaci√≥n entre im√°genes, conceptos y la palabra escrita.
‚Ä¢ Ejercicios agrupados en bloques progresivos: Consonantes, Audici√≥n y Lectura, S√≠labas, Palabras y Frases.
‚Ä¢ Al terminar un ejercicio correctamente, se pasa autom√°ticamente a la siguiente.
‚Ä¢ Al terminar un grupo de ejercicios (1,2,3...), se pasa autom√°ticamente al grupo siguiente.
‚Ä¢ Amenos sonidos para indicar si una respuesta es o no correcta.
‚Ä¢ Opci√≥n de agregar/eliminar una actividad en la lista de favoritos. As√≠, cada vez que se desee repetir una actividad para reforzarla, se puede acceder a ella mediante el bot√≥n del borde inferior.
((‚Ä¢ Una lista de logros mediante las cuales usted, sus hijos o sus alumnos podr√°n reconocer y seguir paso a paso los ejercicios realizados y los conocimientos que ya se han adquirido, o los que falten por reforzar, lo que generar√° un mayor grado de satisfacci√≥n y autoconfianza en la persona.))

¬°Disfrute y recomiende a otros esta fascinante, amena y educativa aplicaci√≥n, imprescindible en su dispositivo!

Conozca nuestros fascinantes audiolibros, juegos y dem√°s aplicaciones sigui√©ndonos en Facebook:
http://www.facebook.com/onlinestudioproductions.com
y tambi√©n en Twitter: https://twitter.com/onlinestudiop

title: Phonogram Sounds
description:
Click a tile and hear the correct pronunciation! This interactive program features clear enunciation of the sounds of the letters and letter combinations (also known as phonograms). Contains all 72 of the basic phonograms as taught in the All About Reading and All About Spelling language arts curriculum.

All About Reading is a multisensory, mastery-based program that starts with essential pre-reading skills and continues on to teach all five key components of reading.

All About Spelling teaches encoding skills, spelling rules, and multisensory strategies to help your student become a proficient speller for life.

Our lightly scripted ‚Äúopen and go‚Äù lesson plans and mastery-based approach leave no gaps and make this curriculum a favorite of homeschool families everywhere. Suitable for all ages and learning styles!

title: Know Yourself Personality Tests by Excel At Life
description:
Test yourself and your friends to compare test results. The results are meant as a guide to help you improve your life and your relationships.

How compatible is your relationship?
‚Ä¢ Both you and your friend can take the tests and obtain compatibility info when you compare your results.
Purpose: To help discuss and analyze relationships.

Do you really know yourself?
‚Ä¢ Have a friend take a test about you and compare results.
CAUTION: Be prepared to learn things you might not want to know.

How Do You Compare to Friends?
‚Ä¢ Compare your results to friends who take the tests on the same device or input their final test scores into your device.

What Is Your Ideal Self?
‚Ä¢ Compare your results with your ideal results to see where you want to make changes.

Content
‚Ä¢ Includes over 40 tests covering more than 100 personality characteristics
‚Ä¢ Personality analysis
‚Ä¢ For self knowledge
‚Ä¢ For self-improvement/self-help
‚Ä¢ For love and dating compatibility - find out about issues that could cause problems in your relationship
‚Ä¢ For understanding friendships, relationships - quiz others
‚Ä¢ Examine self-esteem, work ethic, mental health and much more
‚Ä¢ Based upon psychological research

Some of the tests
‚Ä¢ Your Happiness Assessment - 14 characteristics of happy people
‚Ä¢ Comprehensive Personality Test - 45 traits
‚Ä¢ Cognitive Styles Test -- 13 styles of thinking
‚Ä¢ How Social Are You?
‚Ä¢ Are You A Leader?
‚Ä¢ Are You Conscientious?
‚Ä¢ Perfectionist or Efficient?
‚Ä¢ How Rational Are You?
‚Ä¢ How Insightful Are You?
‚Ä¢ How Creative Are You?
‚Ä¢ How Romantic Are You?
‚Ä¢ Do You Have Anxiety?
‚Ä¢ Do You Have Depression?
‚Ä¢ How Optimistic Are You?
‚Ä¢ What Is Your Self-Concept?
‚Ä¢ Do You Forgive Easily?
‚Ä¢ Do You Have Anger Problems?
‚Ä¢ Self-Control Problems?
‚Ä¢ How Persistent Are You?
‚Ä¢ Do You Have Fear Avoidance?
‚Ä¢ Do You Live Life Fully?
‚Ä¢ How Stressed Are You?
‚Ä¢ Are You Ambitious?
‚Ä¢ How Do You Handle A Crisis?
‚Ä¢ How Mature Are You?

About the developer
This app is based upon research in personality psychology and sponsored by a clinical psychologist specializing in cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT). It is meant for self-help and personality assessment for personal improvement and determining relationship compatibility issues. 

Keep in mind that research-based personality tests may be repetitive, obvious, and even boring to take (especially the longer ones). The purpose is to help you honestly assess yourself and give guidance.

Test results are saved and can be password protected.

title: Learning Ally Audiobooks
description:
This app provides access to Learning Ally‚Äôs library of human-read audiobooks, offering an extensive selection of books students want and need to read, including bestsellers, classic literature and textbooks. Now students have interactive learning tools geared to help them succeed, including highlighted text synced with the audio narration, speed control, bookmarking, highlighting, and note taking.


Learning Ally membership is required to use this app. Learning Ally is for students with dyslexia or other reading deficits who struggle with decoding, fluency or comprehension, who are blind or visually impaired, or who have a physical disability that prohibits them from reading standard print.

If you need help getting started with the Learning Ally Audiobook App, please call our Customer Care team at 800-221-4792 or Contact Us.

Learning Ally membership is required to use this app. Learning Ally is for students with dyslexia or other reading deficits who struggle with decoding, fluency or comprehension, who are blind or visually impaired, or who have a physical disability that prohibits them from reading standard print.

If you need help getting started with the Learning Ally Audiobook App, please call our Customer Care team at 800-221-4792 or Contact Us.
summary: Learning Ally is an educational app designed for learning through listening
recentChanges: Thank you for using Learning Ally Audiobooks! This update delivers a new collection of grade-appropriate recommended audiobooks to your experience!
comments: I'm in the middle of a book series called Stalking Jack the Ripper,but the app cuts the series short, (even young adults like to read too) if the app wasn't vital, I'd look so where else to read. I also can't stand when I'm listening to an audiotext and the voice changes midway through, so ic really prefer to stay with the current narrator. P.S. if you want better ratings try uploading books like the Stalking Jack the Ripper series for older dyslexia readers.

The service is vital but the app itself is terrible. It's definitely something that if I didn't *need* it so bad I wouldn't use it *because* of the app. The app is glitchy and rereads the same pages over and over, shut off at random times, the pages must be manually turned much of the time or it gets sick/goes back to the page you started on at random intervals (too bad if you didn't know your pg #), it shuts off w/ the screen, and there's no option to control the playback from the lock screen.
Whenever I'm listening to a story and my phone screen times out, it will either reread a section that was pages away or it will just abruptly stop.
Audio playback is buggy. Audio skips back randomly making it frustrating to listen to.
This is a great app and I really recommend it. It has EVERYTHING you need to have a good time reading

title: Phonics and Reading I Lite
description:
‚òÖ IT WORKS! ‚òÖ  This is a complete phonics and reading curriculum for beginners.  Over 52 hours of lessons!  The first 10 lessons are free! From introducing letter sounds to reading complete stories, this adaptation of the time-honored McGuffey reading method comes to life as a rich interactive learning experience!

Right away, students are engaged in letter recognition accompanied by charming animations. Phonics Flashcards follow up each lesson. Students learn at a natural pace.  New words are introduced right after teaching the individual phonetic components.  The student then reads complete stories accompanied by the beautiful original color illustrations of Robert Schoolcraft.  

Comes with games and exercises including:
‚Ä¢  Word Truckin‚Äô - Load up your truck with the right letters, and she‚Äôs off!
‚Ä¢  Train for Words - The train is coming up the mountain!  But it needs the right words to keep on chuggin‚Äô! 
‚Ä¢  Phonics Blender  -  Hear your own word creations with the Phonics Blender!  Thousands of fun possibilities!   

Other great features:
‚Ä¢  Supports up to 10 students, and provides student progress saving and tracking.  
‚Ä¢  Teaches to visual, kinetic and auditory learners
‚Ä¢  Designed for non-readers
‚Ä¢  Accelerate students to first-grade reading level
‚Ä¢  Includes special font for dyslexic readers

Invest in a reading tutor with infinite patience - ‚ÄúPhonics and Reading with McGuffey‚Äù.

title: ReadUp by Glifing: Improve your child‚Äôs reading
description:
Do you know that 80% of learning problems are reading problems? Difficulties, such as dyslexia or hyperlexia, in reading can explain 60% of school failure.

ReadUp by Glifing is the game that improves children's reading and reading comprehension using the Glifing method. It is a method that children with reading difficulties can benefit from, regardless of whether they suffer from dyslexia, reading disorder, ADHD, Down syndrome, specific language disorder, stuttering ..., as well as children who already read well but want to read with more fluidity and ease. In addition, it is a complementary application to those already used by schools to teach reading and to reinforce reading. There are already more than 80,000 children around the world who have managed to improve.

Readup by Glifing is aimed at children between 6 and 12 years old who are learning to read or who want to improve or perfect their level. Children with 4 or 5 years old who have a knowledge of letters can also play and learn.

Available in Spanish and Catalan.

Readup by Glifing is divided into reading levels. At the beginning of the game, a level test is carried out on the child to know what their reading level is, this reading level is not linked to the school year, in this way they can learn and improve from their real level.

Within a reader level there are islands and each island has 30 missions to complete. In all missions you are accompanied by the Readup dragon. This friendly character is the mascot for the child and provides instructions to the adult or tutor on how to carry out each of the missions.

A mission brings together all the phases that make up the Glifing method:

1. Phonological path of reading. Train decoding by reading pseudowords.
2. Lexical path of reading. Train the recognition of frequent words globally.
3. Memory training. Strengthens memory, where the phonological imprint and visual memory are improved.
4. Reading comprehension. It requires understanding in the context of previous mission activities.

In each mission you can get up to 3 stars, these are determined according to the successes that have been completed in each of the previous activities.

Finally, so that the playful part of the game is understood, at the end of the mission, there is a minigame, the objective of which is to feed the dragon, and here you can also obtain gems depending on how well it is done.

Stars and gems can be used to customize the dragon in Readup's Dragon Shop. Therefore, the more you play, the more missions will be completed, and the more fun customizations you can make to the dragon.

We believe that parents or guardians are an essential part in the education of children, for this reason, in each mission it is required that the lexical and morphological path activities be carried out jointly with them, that is, it will be the parent or guardian who determines if the child has pronounced the word correctly. When it is not possible to be together, the tutor mode can be disabled and those missions are marked with an exclamation to remember that that part is missing to complete it. We know that there are automatic methods of voice recognition, but we are committed to strengthening the relationship between parents (or guardians) with children.

Glifing is based on its own method registered under a research project carried out at the UB (University of Barcelona). If you want more information about the method, visit: https://www.glifing.com

If you want to know more information about ReadUp, visit: https://www.readupbyglifing.site

If you want to see the practical case of a school that uses the Glifing method, go to: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Pf7UogBqXn4

Do you want to see how ReadUp is played in a family? Look at this video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dLG5XIYzLUI

What are you waiting for to start improving reading and reading comprehension? Download it for free now!
descriptionHTML:
Do you know that 80% of learning problems are reading problems? Difficulties, such as dyslexia or hyperlexia, in reading can explain 60% of school failure.

ReadUp by Glifing is the game that improves children's reading and reading comprehension using the Glifing method. It is a method that children with reading difficulties can benefit from, regardless of whether they suffer from dyslexia, reading disorder, ADHD, Down syndrome, specific language disorder, stuttering ..., as well as children who already read well but want to read with more fluidity and ease. In addition, it is a complementary application to those already used by schools to teach reading and to reinforce reading. There are already more than 80,000 children around the world who have managed to improve.

title: Hangman Kid's App for Spelling Word Practice
description:
Spelling Bug Hangman helps kids with spelling practice by using the classic hangman word game.

100% Money Back Guarantee - You love it or your money back! Read more here: http://aceedutainmentapps.com/support.html 

The world‚Äôs favorite kid‚Äôs spelling practice game just got a whole lot better. Do spelling practice for school or just for fun! Play alone or with a friend. See if you can guess all the letters to spell the mystery word before the caterpillar chomps through the vine and makes the baby butterfly fall. Every time you guess a letter in the word correctly, the chrysalis will grow a little, but, watch out, every time you guess wrong the caterpillar will chomp on the vine! You are in luck though‚Äîyou earn coins to buy clues that will help you free the butterfly. Oh, and did we tell you that you can find your very own super cute avatar bug to play with?

Spelling Bug Hangman - spelling practice with over 100 built in word lists for children ages 5 to 10. This spelling game also helps kids with dyslexia and ESL students learn

‚Ä¢ Learning in a fun way using an old favorite spelling practice for kids
‚Ä¢ Add your own spelling words. Perfect for practicing your homework words!
‚Ä¢ Record your own voice clues. 
‚Ä¢ Play Spelling Bug Hangman with a friend or on your own and learn while you play
‚Ä¢ See many different clues, including pictures, sound and word shapes to solve the spelling word
‚Ä¢ Follow your progress and show your teacher/parents how much you have learnt
‚Ä¢ Hangman matches your skills level automatically.
‚Ä¢ Whether you are a spelling bee star or someone who struggles with dyslexia or an ESL student, this word game will help you learn

‚Ä¢ Do spelling practice and follow your progress. Show your teacher/parents how much you have learnt with this word game
‚Ä¢ This game is great for English Second Language learners and kids with dyslexia because of the picture clues
‚Ä¢ Awarded KID SAFE ‚Äì no annoying ads or links to the internet
‚Ä¢ See you kids learn new sounds and words FAST - Designed by teachers using the phonics method.
‚Ä¢ The teacher that developed this app specializes in teaching kids with learning difficulties like dyslexia.

comments: This app doesn't work even if you paid for the upgraded version. The app doesn't allow you to customize the spelling list. I get an error message " EZSTT DEMO". I wish I knew that info before I upgraded the app.

App deletes custom words and profiles when it closes. No parent has time to add the words everytime their kid closes the app. This is what databases and files are for. Requesting a refund. Would repurchase if this issue was addressed.
Doesn't save custom words, who has time to be entering this every time. Not much good.

I used it for the first time today.  I added my daughter's homework in the custom selection and it doesn't let you lable/ title your customer list.   Once we started it started glitching right away.   Please fix it or give me my money back.

This app would be great if it worked properly. 75% of the time, the keyboard on the custom list games doesn't work. I didn't see any others using this problem, so I'm not sure why mine is doing this. Unfortunately, I'm out the money on a broken game.

title: Kids Spelling 500 words
description:
A self paced educational learning app that teaches children how to spell more than 500 common English words. The learning process is accomplished in three stages: learning, practise and checking.

The program consists of word sets beginning with easy three letter words and working up to eight letter words as well as theme based words covering subjects such as animals, colors, fruit, shapes, numbers transportation and vegetables.  

In learning mode, the program shows a picture of the new word being learnt and the word is read aloud, the completed word is also shown momentarily. Children can then select the letters that make up word with the ability to revisit the completed word as many times as necessary.

In practise mode, the completed word is not shown, but feedback is provided to indicate whether the word is spelt correctly with advancement to the next word only possible when the word has been correctly completed.

In check and test mode, no hints on the correct spelling of the word are provided and all letters of the alphabet are options to be selected.

This app is suitable for preschool children wanting to get a head start on spelling before starting school as well as older children who are already at school and who want to further improve their spelling and word recognition skills.

From the award winning educational game developer.

Kids Spelling Fun has:
‚Ä¢ a large variety of over 500 English words to learn
‚Ä¢ high quality images set against colourful scenes that look great on High Definition (HD) and retina displays
‚Ä¢ spoken pronunciation for every word
‚Ä¢ the ability to learn using either uppercase or lowercase letter tiles 
‚Ä¢ self paced learning in three distinct modes: learning, practise and test modes
‚Ä¢ increasing difficulty starting with easy three letter words and working up to eight letter words
‚Ä¢ additional word sets that cover specific topics such as animals, colors, fruit, numbers, shapes, transport and vegetables 
‚Ä¢ no advertising

Kids Spelling Fun comes with a selection of free words to learn which can be easily upgraded through a single low cost in-app purchase to enable all 500+ words. By upgrading from the Free App to the full version you‚Äôll also be entitled to all features added in future releases.

We hope you and your children enjoy playing what we believe is one of our best early education games for preschoolers and school age kids.

Please also check out our other puzzle games and acclaimed kids educational apps at http://espacepublishing.com or follow us on Facebook for the scoop on new app releases and free giveaways at http://facebook.com/espacepublishing.

comments: Great Spelling app. Has learning mode LM & testing mode TM. LM: good for visual/kinetic learners. Shows the spelling of each word at start (& can reshow the word); Has only correct letters to choose from when spelling. TM: harder version. Suggestion: 1) a record of child's progress/%. 2) more than one learning path for more kids 3) needs options eg: USA or UK spelling; number of words in each test; font; group words as families 4) be able to correct own mistakes in LM (particularly last letter)

My three year old loves this game! easy to use, multiple difficulties. I love that it's available offline. We used the free version for a long time, but my kid mastered all the words and was ready for a bigger challenge. Some of the negative reviews are laughable considering my three-year-old can use it without issue. FYI it is in traditional British English, so there are a few minimal spelling and pronunciation variations. For example the way they spell practice with an s instead of c.

I like this app. Our daughter is dyslexic and immediately jumped into the learning and testing which showed her she needed to really pay attention and work to progress. However i don't see scores shown to encourage progress. I would also like the option to have the letters read aloud l (and not) in learning mode.

Your App is great bu there one limitation that is it does not sound when we click on a letter i e while writing PEN it should Pa when we click on Letter P, While clicking on letter E it should sound e, while clicking on letter N it should sould sound na, so that children can learn letter and their joining automatically, with out any external help. I hope you will look into my suggestion.
sure it could be good, not enough free words to actually be effective. uninstalled.

title: Language and Cognitive Therapy for Children (MITA)
description:
‚Ä¢ THE FIRST AND ONLY LANGUAGE THERAPY APPLICATION SUPPORTED BY CLINICAL DATA: 
In a 3-year clinical trial of 8,766 children with autism, young children who trained with MITA improved their language score at the end of the trial on average 3-times more than similar children who did not use MITA. See results at ClinicalTrials.gov/ct2/show/results/NCT02708290. 

‚Ä¢ Includes unlimited language and cognitive exercises designed to last for 10 years

‚Ä¢ Used by over 1,000,000 children with language delay

‚Ä¢ Best Autism App on the Healthline‚Äôs list

‚Ä¢ Available in English, Spanish, Portuguese, Russian, German, French, Italian, Arabic, Farsi, and Chinese.

Mental Imagery Therapy for Autism (MITA) is a unique, early-intervention application for children with language delay and autism. MITA trains mental integration and language, starting with simple vocabulary, and progressing towards higher forms of language, such as adjectives, verbs, pronouns, and syntax.


MITA EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES

‚Ä¢ Based on ABA techniques of visual-visual and auditory-visual conditional discrimination.
‚Ä¢ Based on language therapy technique of following directions with increasing complexity.
‚Ä¢ Based on Pivotal Response Treatment that targets development of response to multiple cues. 
‚Ä¢ Each activity is adaptive and delivers exercises that are at the exact level of difficulty appropriate for your child at any given point in time
‚Ä¢ Identify colors, patterns and sizes
‚Ä¢ Integrate objects into a unified picture
‚Ä¢ Spatial Prepositions: on/under/behind/in front
‚Ä¢ Time prepositions: Before/After
‚Ä¢ Passive verb tense
‚Ä¢ Subject / Object
‚Ä¢ Reading and Writing
‚Ä¢ Numbers and counting
‚Ä¢ Arithmetic
‚Ä¢ Logic and reasoning
‚Ä¢ Mental perspective taking
‚Ä¢ Mental mathematics
‚Ä¢ Playtime rewards will keep your child engaged while learning and having fun
‚Ä¢ No Wi-Fi necessary
‚Ä¢ No ads

MITA develops your child‚Äôs imagination and language functions. The visual exercises follow a systematic approach for developing your child's ability to notice multiple features of an object. MITA starts with simple exercises that teach your child to attend to only one feature, such as size (screenshot  #1) or color (#2). Over time, the exercises get more difficult and require your child to attend to two features simultaneously, such as both color and size (#3). Once your child has practiced attending to two features, the program moves on to puzzles that require attending to three features, such as color, size and shape (#4), and then eventually to puzzles that involve attending to an ever-increasing number of characteristics. 
The verbal exercises offer a more conventional approach to language acquisition, starting with simple vocabulary, and progressing towards higher forms of language, such as adjectives, prepositions, and syntax.
MITA is designed for early childhood and intended for long-term, daily use. It is engaging and educational, as well as adaptive and responsive to the individual abilities of each child. MITA exercises can be used by children with language delay, ASD, PDD, intellectual and developmental disability (IDD), Down syndrome, and other neurodevelopmental disorders as a supplement to conventional speech therapy.

MITA is developed by Dr. A. Vyshedskiy, a neuroscientist from Boston University; R. Dunn, a Harvard-educated early-child-development specialist; MIT-educated, J. Elgart and a group of award-winning artists and developers working alongside experienced therapists.

MITA in the news: https://youtu.be/giZymh3rMHc
MITA research articles: http://imagiration.com/research/

recentChanges:
‚Ä¢ THE FIRST AND ONLY LANGUAGE THERAPY APPLICATION SUPPORTED BY CLINICAL DATA:
In a 3-year clinical trial of 6,454 children with autism, language score in children who engaged with MITA has increased to levels, which were 70% higher than in children with similar initial evaluations. ‚Ä¢ Adds 15 New Games.

comments: Very good game! Thus, for language it is important 1. To decrease delays between trials - they wre very long and a child loses attention, while in language teavhing procedure speed is a vital clue. 2. It is important before changing the "level" to verify that a word is really remembered. I have to change a level back manually at each session, because I am sure that my child does not remember a name of an object, but got the program algoryth using visual clues.
My child using it for 10 months and his improvement is really grate. Very useful app for autistic child like my son.
My 3 year loves using this app. It has definitely helped us.
It helps my 6 year old. Great app.. üëçAfter a few months of use, the challenge is keeping him interested as he now rejects doing this... For variety, can pictures change? Like plants? Thanks..

4 stars as a start. As the parent of a Autistic child, your "app" is challenging, easy to comprehend by the child, fast, with continuous flow of activities per letters.. THANKS, for this DEVZ. More power to you, & GOD bless you!!

title: Child Tests - Kid's game
description:
The application contains tests for children of 3-4 years old. With this game you will be able to teach your children at home, in the car, on the train or in another place convenient for you. The app contains tasks which improve children speech, attention, thinking; help with math, teach about the surrounding world and many other things. Teaching children through games  brings not only benefits  but also  pleasure. Adults should help to study with the application by reading  the  task and setting  time to solve it.  Some of the tests are no interactive, they need an oral answer to a question, which improves children speech. Most of the questions are interactive with choosing right options. Some tasks in the game involve selecting pairs of correct answers. These tasks  improve children's logic. Also, there are questions in which the child should "draw" a correct answer, for example, find a way out of the maze. At first you should click on the "edit" button and then in the window appeared draw an answer with your finger or a stylus pen.
The questions are of the following types:
 --  "A simple question" - the child must respond verbally.
 -- "A pair of questions" - the child should choose the right pair of options.
 -- "A question with variants" - the child needs to choose the right answer from the suggested ones.
 -- "A question with a timer" - a child needs to remember a picture and give a correct answer about it.
 -- "A complex question" - the question contains sub questions.
 -- "A group question" - the objects should be grouped by some property.
 -- "An art question" - a child can draw the answer with their fingers or a stylus pen.

All questions are grouped by types (themes):
- Improvement of thinking
- Improvement of attention
- Perfection of memory
- Mathematics tasks

- The world around us
This kid's game application is not only pleasant but also useful
Praise your child as often as you can and you will be surprised how quickly you child will develop.
descriptionHTML:
The application contains tests for children of 3-4 years old. With this game you will be able to teach your children at home, in the car, on the train or in another place convenient for you. The app contains tasks which improve children speech, attention, thinking; help with math, teach about the surrounding world and many other things. Teaching children through games brings not only benefits but also pleasure. Adults should help to study with the application by reading the task and setting time to solve it. Some of the tests are no interactive, they need an oral answer to a question, which improves children speech. Most of the questions are interactive with choosing right options. Some tasks in the game involve selecting pairs of correct answers. These tasks improve children's logic. Also, there are questions in which the child should "draw" a correct answer, for example, find a way out of the maze. At first you should click on the "edit" button and then in the window appeared draw an answer with your finger or a stylus pen.
The questions are of the following types:
-- "A simple question" - the child must respond verbally.
-- "A pair of questions" - the child should choose the right pair of options.
-- "A question with variants" - the child needs to choose the right answer from the suggested ones.
-- "A question with a timer" - a child needs to remember a picture and give a correct answer about it.
-- "A complex question" - the question contains sub questions.
-- "A group question" - the objects should be grouped by some property.
-- "An art question" - a child can draw the answer with their fingers or a stylus pen.

All questions are grouped by types (themes):
- Improvement of thinking
- Improvement of attention
- Perfection of memory
- Mathematics tasks
- Improvement of speech
- Improvement of fine motor skills
- The world around us
This kid's game application is not only pleasant but also useful
Praise your child as often as you can and you will be surprised how quickly you child will develop.
summary: Game for children 3-4 years old to improve speaking, logic, thinking
recentChanges: update target sdk to 28

title: CogniFit- Test & Brain Games
description:
CogniFit offers a scientific patented technology and it is recognized as a global leader in the  Cognitive Assessment & Training Market. CogniFit offers scientifically validated brain fitness solutions. - Join CogniFit, an experienced and authoritative provider of digital brain training games and brain tests. This app offers engaging games to evaluate and train memory, concentration, attention, mental arithmetic, executive functions, reasoning, planning, mental agility, coordination, and more.

CogniFit is a leading interactive mental game application that helps stimulate cognitive skills through personalized daily training. Compare your cognitive skills with the rest of the global population and activate your brain with brain challenges, memory games, puzzles, ingenious games, and much more!

IT INCLUDES:
‚óè Personalized Brain Training programs designed to help train your brain.
‚óè Mental challenges and exercises that test logic and problem-solving skills.
‚óè More than 20 mental games created to improve memory, attention, coordination, reasoning, and more. 
‚óè Personalized daily mental agility exercises and games focused on stimulating cognitive abilities based on your cognitive profile results.
‚óè Mental exercises and challenges specific to children and adults.
‚óè Detailed tracking of user progress and performance
...and much more!


DEVELOPED BY NEUROSCIENTIFIC EXPERTS

Choosing applications with scientifically-validated activities, such as those offered by CogniFit ‚Äî an app created by experts in neuroscience ‚Äî is critical for properly evaluating and training brain functions.

This application is easy to use and accessible for a wide range of users. The application adapts automatically to the specific cognitive needs of each user, from children 7 years old, to adults, and even seniors.

Effective technology used by the scientific community, universities, hospitals, families, and medical centers around the world.

comments: I really, really enjoy the app... But I bought the subscription for a year, and it never loaded. The exact dollar amount was taken off my debt card. I'm giving it 4 stars, when normally I would 1 star an app for taking my money. However, their customer support is outstanding!! ü§ó üíï

I like the app. The only thing that truely bothers me is that there is not a mute button/setting to mute the music while playing the games.

title: Chatable - Focus your Hearing, Remove Distraction
description:
Chatable is the easy way to focus on speech. If you have ADHD, ADD, Autism, Dyslexia or Hearing loss, then this app is perfect for you. Try free now. 

Chatable improves attention by helping you focus on speech.  Our A.I. removes background noise and improves your concentration for one to one conversation.  Try for free today.  

‚ÄúChatable will be majorly life changing for many people.‚Äù - European Audiologist of the Year 2019, Paula Cooke
 
Chatable uses headphones to turn your smartphone into a listening device that will boost volume of speech and remove distracting or overwhelming background noise. The result is, easier listening, more productive conversations, improved focus, lower stress levels and more enjoyable TV listening

Who is Chatable For? 

Chatable may help a diverse range of hearing, neurodevelopmental and processing disorders. 

Used with a listening device, Chatable can help with: 
- Processing and learning disorders such as ADHD, APD and Dyslexia
- Communication and behaviour disorders affected by listening and concentration such as Autism (Autism Spectrum Disorder) and Aspergers 
- Mild, moderate, severe, profound hearing loss
- Temporary relief from Tinnitus or background noise
 
For neurodevelopmental and processing disorders, we recommend you use noise cancelling headphones with the app for optimal experience. 

What is Chatable for? 

- Hearing one to one conversation 
- Coping in noisy and overwhelming environments 
- Improve attention and focus in the classroom / lecture 
- Use Chatable as a remote microphone or listening device
- Listening to the television or the radio, as a voice sound amplifier or listening device
- Hearing someone through facemasks 
- Listening better at work meetings
- Enhancing your hearing aid or cochlear implant  
- A backup hearing aid
 
Chatable is easy to set up and use, with no hearing test, doctor appointment, or audiologist calibration needed. Simply connect to your wired headphones, or existing hearing aid or listening device. 
 
What can you expect from Chatable? 
- Enhances focus on conversation 
- Removes stressful noise, relax easier and relieve Tinnitus
- Reduces listening effort 
- Improves speech processing 
- Less reliance on lipreading 
- Ability to listen from a distance 
- Listen to the TV at lower volume 
- Reduced usage of captions for the TV
 
You can see all our testimonials here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJMyHV-vL5zefAu7I0x0RDA/videos

How does it work?


Dr. Andy Simpson, pioneer in auditory neuroscience and AI, designed and engineered VOXimity‚Ñ¢, our proprietary technology, to help people focus on conversation and reduce the volume of background noise. 

If you want to learn more about the invention of VOXimity‚Ñ¢, check out the Chatable blog: https://blog.chatableapps.com/index.php/2020/01/02/the-invention-of-chatableapps

Chatable is free to install and use. Enjoy 100 minutes of free use every month, and subscribe for unlimited access.

Chatable is not a hearing aid. This is an app that uses the mobile platform for recording audio and replaying audio with or without amplification, or other similar functionalities and that uses the mobile platform to translate unintelligible speech for better clarity.
